loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo started her business in 2005. The first loan she received from MLF Microvinest helped her significantly and that is why she always comes to Microinvest to take out loans. Now she is intending to get funds for purchase of winter clothes.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora is a mother of 3 children and has worked in the bazaar for over 6 years.  She started to take loans from Microinvest in 2005.  Since that time, she has shown herself to be an active and responsible woman. All her clients say that she services them quickly and politely. Today she has good turnover of her working capital and is going to spend her future loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a dedicated entrepreneur who sells shoes at the busy Barabashovo market in Kharkiv, the second largest city in Ukraine. An experienced business owner, she has been in business for about ten years. She is able to buy shoes wholesale from a large distributor and then resells them for a profit. Anna is divorced and has two kids. Her business is a valuable source of income for her family.

Anna has requested a loan to help purchase some new inventory. The onset of the colder season makes this a busy time of the year for many market vendors. This loan will enable Anna to capitalize on demand and increase her profits while she works to support herself and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en: Uguloy is married and has 4 children who help her with her business. She has been engaged in business for over 8 years and has good experience in business. Her business is located at a big market in Spitamen, a district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She became a client of MLF Microinvest in 2003 and her first loan was for 300 somoni. During her time working in the market, she has attracted many clients and learned much about their tastes.  She always tries to meet their needs and quickly innovate her assortment according to their needs. Now she wants to include in her assortment confectionery products as she knows that the demand for this kind of product during holiday trade days will be greater than during other times of the year and she wants to earn a big profit from it.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Larysa

texts.en:
Larysa is an enterprising business owner from Kharkov, Ukraine. She has a busy footwear sales business located at the Barabashova Rhinok (market) in Kharkov. Larysa purchases shoes and boots from China where she is able to get good prices. She sells from her little stand at the market and also sells bulk supplies of footwear if needed by a customer. Larysa started her business about 12 years ago. She is divorced and is raising one child. One of her goals for the future is to be able to buy her own apartment.

Larysa has requested a short term loan of $1000 to purchase a new supply of inventory. Larysa has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past and has even co-signed for others to receive loans. We are happy for this opportunity to assist her as she works to make a living.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a hard working business owner from Nicolaev, Ukraine. She has a women’s clothing business located at the Sigma Sport retail center in Nicolaev. Nina has much experience in the retail trade, stretching all the way back to Soviet times. Before the collapse of the Soviet Union she was the manager of a clothing store. She has owned her own business for the past seven years. Nina is married. She and her husband have a 22 year old son. Nina’s business has become the main source of income for her family.

Nina has requested a loan of $700 to add to her working capital. Her business is growing. Financial assistance will help her to continue operating successfully and support her family

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara has a small women’s lingerie business located at the Sigma Sports retail mall in Nicolaev, Ukraine. Tamara is divorced and is raising her six year old daughter, Anna, on her own. She works hard to support herself and her daughter. Tamara’s business has proven to be successful. In a typical month she makes around $1400 in profit and she has about $2000 invested in inventory. Tamara has developed loyal customers and is a good example of service and a kind attitude toward her clients.

Tamara would like to purchase a new vending location and has requested a loan of $1200 to give her the capital she needs. Tamara has proven to be a good loan client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine and we are happy to have this new opportunity to help her improve her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Open a new location

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his barber shop.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
I am Shazia B. from Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of three, two boys and one girl. All of my children attend school except the youngest, who is not of school going age yet. I am a textile artist and I embroider clothes on piecework order. My husband runs a small factory where he manufactures beads and sequins. 
I want to expand my embroidery business for which I require a loan of $200.I will buy an embroidery frame and some other related items with this money.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en: My name is Akhter B.. I am married and a mother of eight. I live with my family in Lahore, a city with great history in Pakistan. I sell clothes, blankets and crockery door-to-door. My husband divorced me few years ago and he married another woman. I am the only breadwinner for my family. I need to expand my business in order to increase my income. Therefore, I request a loan of $350 to buy some new items for my business such as irons, juice extractors and bed sheets.

loans.use: Expand current business

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
”My house was constructed many years ago, so with the passing of time it has deteriorated considerably. It is urgent that I repair a fence that is about to fall, and I also want to add a room in the second floor of my home so that my family has more living space. I am requesting a $1,200 loan to repair a fence and for the construction of an additional room in the second floor of my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa hace muchos años que se construyo, así es que con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado mucho me urge reparar una barda que esta por caerse y quiero también construir un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda para tener más espacio para mi familia” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la reparación de una barda y la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de mi vivienda

loans.use: Repair a fence and build an additional room in the second floor of my home.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti U. is 29 years old, mother of a child aged 2. Selling kerosene is her new business since her first business was failed. Sometimes she sells cigarettes together with her husband. She can earn $5.5 per day and its just enough for her daily needs. She requests IDR 900,000 to complete and expand her business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teten

texts.en: Teten is 32 years old and a mother of a 14-year-old daughter. She sells snacks, household goods, cooking oil, rice, etc. She usually earns $8.5 per day. Her husband, Zarkasih, sells glasses and usually earns $16.5 per day. She also plants rice. She requests IDR 900,000 loan to complete her shop, buy some fertilizer and for her husband's business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade is a 31-year-old woman. She and her husband run a home industry which produce chips. They produce and sell them to the market or directly to the customer. She usually earns $7 per day and requests an IDR 500,000 loan expand her business and hire more workers to increase production. She  is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase production of chips

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Ricardina is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. She leaves very early every day to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved aunt. She was supported by an initial loan that made this possible after having suffered a large loss of money last year due to the terrible cold that attacked their fields. Now she is more peaceful and happier because she found in the advice of her aunt a good way to care for her beloved son, who is ten-years-old. She wants to keep educating him because she hopes that he reaches the goals that he has laid out for himself. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a calf and to improve her stable. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ricardina, es una mujer muy trabajadora y su diligencia es increíble, trabaja con una fortaleza de inmensa admiración. Siempre ha buscado la forma de ser una protagonista importante al momento de proveer de un ingreso extra a la economía de su casa. Cada día sale muy temprano para dar de comer a sus vacas y toros, con la finalidad de engordarlos y comercializarlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local. Inició esta ocupación por recomendación y enseñanza de su querida tía y apoyada por un préstamo inicial que posibilitó este hecho después de haber sufrido una cuantiosa pérdida de dinero el año pasado, por la terrible fuerza del frío que azotó sus campos de cultivo.Ahora está más tranquila y contenta porque encontró en el consejo de su querida tía una buena forma de ocuparse cuidando de su querido hijo de diez años en casa; quiere seguir educando a su pequeño porque desea que alcance cada una de las metas que se ha trazado, es por esta razón que está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una vaquita más y mejorar su establo.Apoya a esta mujer de mucha fortaleza y coraje para seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf and improving her small stable.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is a young mother who works for the progress and well-being of her family. She is the mother of four children, and the youngest requires lots of attention and care due to the fact that he just began his life cycle with his loving mother. While she tries to gather energy to continue with her work breeding small animals, particularly guinea pigs, her husband has the difficult task of working in the fields.

Genoveva’s conventional activities secure monthly revenue that allows her to be an important source of income in her home. She remembers fondly the days in which her aunt encouraged her to take this occupation for the benefit of her loved ones. As such, this occupation allows her to adequately distribute her time to tend to her little ones and not neglect her house chores being that it is where she also cares for her animals. Recently, she has decided to raise sheep and to provide them with an adequate and hygienic area, she is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase building materials to provide them with comfortable space. Support this humble mother to continue working diligently. Your contribution is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva, es una joven madre que trabaja para el progreso y bienestar de su familia, es madre de cuatro niños y el más pequeño aún requiere de mucha atención y cuidado debido a que acaba de iniciar su ciclo de vida junto a su cariñosa madre. Mientras ella trata de recuperar energías para continuar con sus labores de crianza de animalitos pequeños y en especial de cuyes, su esposo se dedica a las duras labores del campo.Las actividades convencionales de Genoveva le aseguran un ingreso económico mensual que le permite ser una fuente de financiamiento importante en su hogar, ella recuerda con mucho agrado los días en que su tía la animaba a dedicarse a esta labor para beneficio de los suyos. Así mismo este trabajo le permite distribuir adecuadamente su tiempo para atender las solicitudes de sus pequeños y no descuidar sus labores en casa ya que cuida también de sus animalitos en el interior de la misma, recientemente se ha animado a criar ovejitas y para dotarlas de un espacio adecuado e higiénico solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra materiales a fin de acondicionarles un espacio cómodo. Apoya a esta humilde madre a seguir trabajando esforzadamente, tu contribución es muy importante.

loans.use: Purchase building materials to provide her sheep with comfortable space inside her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a native of Colpar, an annex in the Quilcas District in Huancayo. Juan has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and bulls and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background, and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children. His immense wishes for self-improvement, despite having encountered terrible times of crisis due to inclement winter weather that struck his growing fields on more than one occasion, have led him to choose to intensify his means of making a living. For this reason, he would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. Extend your solidarity to Juan so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish each one of his proposed plans.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Juan, es natural de Colpar, un anexo del Distrito de Quilcas en Huancayo, siempre optó por apostar por su tierra, para forjarse y desarrollarse en ella. Así fue como decidió criar vacas y toritos y dedicarse a la agricultura y hace mucho tiempo que se viene dedicando a estas labores, pues él proviene de una familia netamente agricultora y ahora se ha convertido en el encargado de transmitir toda esa experiencia a sus hijos.Sus inmensos deseos de superación a pesar de haber enfrentado terribles épocas de crisis económica debido a la inclemencia del invierno que azotó en más de una oportunidad sus campos de cultivo, lo llevan planear la intensificación de su labor ganadera y es por esta razón que desea comprar vacas con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y el bienestar de su hogar con los innumerables beneficios que le otorgan día a día estos especiales animalitos.Solidarízate con Don Juan para que siga adelante y cumpla cada una de los planes que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Buy more cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his family.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora is very gifted in sales, and she enjoys her job peddling cheese and other dairy products. Every thirty days, she travels to the city of Lima to offer her goods in this city as well. She has been doing the latter task for one year, taking advantage of the continuous visits she makes to her eldest children who live in that city. She does this for a living because it is the only support for her last three children, who are studying in a small educational center in their city. After separating from her husband, she has carried out the roles of father and mother for them, and although her husband sends her some money for the support of their children, it does not suffice. Nora’s wish is to also venture into clothing sales, which she could do upon returning from her travels and sell the garments in the streets of her town, to generate additional income and support the well-being of her loving family. Support Nora to continue persevering. She thanks you for your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora, es una mujer talentosa con las ventas y le agrada su trabajo, ella se dedica a la comercialización de quesos y productos lácteos de manera ambulante, cada treinta días viaja a la ciudad de Lima para ofrecer también su mercadería en esta ciudad.Esta última labor la viene realizando desde hace un año constantemente aprovechando las visitas continuas que les hace a sus hijos mayores que radican ahí y viene dedicándose a esta actividad porque es el único sostén de sus tres últimos hijos que están estudiando en un pequeño centro educativo de su ciudad, tras la separación con su esposo ella ha desempeñado los roles de padre y madre para ellos y aunque su esposo manda un poco de dinero para el sostén de sus hijos es insuficiente.Lo que desea, Nora, es también dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir cuando retorne de sus viajes a fin de repartirlas de manera ambulante por las calles de su ciudad y generar ingresos adicionales en bienestar de su querida familia.Apoya a Nora a seguir adelante, ella te agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase capital to venture into clothing sales in addition to her cheese and dairy product sales.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
The yearning to get ahead that Isabel has increases her will of progressing. This is how, after seeing the market opportunities in her area, she decided to fix up a space in her home three months ago to offer Internet services to her community. All of this effort is driven by the immense love she has for her small daughter, Estefani Nicol, who is her reason for living, despite the fact that she doesn't have the moral support of her partner. He limits himself to providing an amount of money that many times is insufficient to cover the needs of her daughter. With the hope of offering the best to Estefani, she resumed her studies that she had abandoned with the purpose of finishing them and starting her career as a teacher and to offer private classes in her home as a consultant. She knows that this requires an investment, and that's why she is requesting a loan to invest in the upkeep of the computers in her small Internet café. With the profits, she will be able to cover her education costs and will be able to offer well-being and security to her daughter. Let's support the success of this young mother who is giving the best to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Las ganas de superación que tiene Isabel, incrementan su voluntad de progreso y es así que viendo las oportunidades de mercado en su zona decidió hace tres meses acondicionó un espacio de su hogar para ofrecer servicios de internet a su comunidad. Todo este esfuerzo es impulsado por el inmenso amor de su pequeña, Estefani Nicol, que es su razón de vivir y a pesar de que ella se encuentra sola sin el apoyo moral de su pareja, quien sólo se limita a alcanzarle una suma de dinero que muchas veces es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades que demanda su niña.Con el deseo de ofrecerle lo mejor a Estefani, reanudó sus estudios de educación que había abandonado con el propósito de culminarla y ejercer su carrera ofreciendo sus servicios de maestra y captar alumnos particulares en su domicilio a fin de otorgarles asesoría particular; ella sabe que todo esto requiere de una inversión y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en el mantenimiento de las computadoras de su cabina de Internet. Con las ganancias podrá cubrir sus gastos educativos y le podrá ofrecer bienestar y seguridad a su pequeña. Apoyemos y apostemos por la superación de una joven madre que da lo mejor para su hija.

loans.use: Providing upkeep to her computers so they will provide better and faster service.

loans.name: Claritza

texts.es:
Claritza is very creative since she needs to sell the garments she makes. Fortunately, this activity substantially covers her rent, which makes her very content. She dedicated herself to clothing sales two years ago, when it was clear that her husband's salary as a taxi driver was insufficient to meet all their family's needs and desires. Since two years have passed, Claritza currently wishes to improve her merchandise and increase her inventory with a variety of sizes, styles, and colors. She also wants her business to be situated in a permanent location in a commercial district for stability. She would like to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices, and thus, seeks your help with the goal to sustain familial accord and well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Claritza, es muy creativa para asegurar las ventas de sus prendas de vestir, gracias a esta actividad es un sostén importante en la economía de su hogar y se siente muy satisfecha por ello. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir hace doce años debido a que el ingreso económico que percibía su esposo como chofer de taxis era insuficiente para la plena satisfacción de las necesidades y deseos de su querida familia. Ahora han pasado esos doce años y Claritza desea mejorar su mercadería surtiéndola con mayor cantidad y variedad de tallas, modelos y colores y quiere ubicarse en un stand de ventas para instalarse definitivamente en una zona para comercializarlas de manera permanente con mayor seguridad.Y para comprar mayor mercadería al por mayor solicita vuestra ayuda con el objetivo de mantener la armonía familiar y el bienestar en su hogar.

loans.use: To buy larger quantity and variety of clothes to sell, a permanent clothing stand in a commercial district for stability

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo is an enthusiast: her charisma helps to sell the immense variety of toys, gifts, and decorations she has for all occasions. For example, on Mothers' Day, she sells roses and card gifts; when they celebrate Halloween, she sells home decorations and costumes and masks for children. Now, she is preparing for Christmas to sell ornaments in a couple of weeks. For the moment, she continues to travel around to sell toys and trinkets from a mobile stand. She has a pressing need to rent a small tricycle so she can move her Christmas products around as well as some capital to buy novelty items to gain some substantial profits. This will allow her to invest in another business activity in the future and improve her dear family's standard of living. Let's make this woman's request possible since her business is successful.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Amparo, es muy entusiasta, el carisma que tiene la ayuda mucho al momento de comercializar la inmensa variedad de juguetes y adornos que posee para diversas temporadas y ocasiones. Por ejemplo en el día de las madres vende rosas y tarjetas para regalar, cuando celebran haloween adornos para decorar la casa y algunos disfraces y máscaras para los niños. Ahora para navidad se está preparando para en un par de semanas iniciar la venta de artículos de decoración, por el momento continúa vendiendo juguetes de manera ambulante.Su apremiante necesidad es obtener un pequeño triciclo en alquiler para movilizar los objetos navideños y así mismo una inyección de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de novedosos artículos para alcanzar sustanciales ganancias que le permitan su futura inversión en otra actividad comercial con el propósito de incrementar el nivel de vida de su querida familia.Posibilitemos su petición para que su actividad comercial sea exitosa.

loans.use: To rent a small tricycle and capital to buy more various Christmas items

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a skilful artist whose hands produce fine work and beautiful carpets, together with her loyal partner. She has been working at this worthy occupation ever since she was a little girl, when her family passed on to her all of their knowledge about the art of weaving. They also taught her basic criteria for combining colors, which now helps her produce high quality and finely finished goods. She has some export projects and has begun the necessary paperwork for this, as she has accumulated orders from several establishments that want products to sell.

The business’s continual progress fills her with satisfaction. Day by day they innovate their designs and try to apply new weaving techniques to their cloaks and carpets. With that same spirit of innovation they now produce produce shawls and cloaks for babies using alpaca and cotton fibers. Their work is of such excellent quality that it is in high demand and they make goods only by request. All of their efforts are motivated by the desires of their four children, who are committed to the family business and want to study administration, finance and exporting with the goal of making the business more competitive.

Graciela is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to continue producing carpets and other goods, and with the earnings will be able to satisfy the needs and desires of her children. In addition, she would like to build on to her house to expand the workshop where they weave. Let’s support this artistic couple so they can continue making progress and holding onto their dreams of success.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una hábil artista, sus manos producen finos trabajos y produce bellas alfombras en compañía de su fiel compañero; este digno oficio viene desempeñándolo desde muy niña ya que su familia le dejó como herencia todos los conocimientos en el arte del tejido a telar, así mismo la dotó de los criterios básicos para la combinación de colores que ahora le sirven para tener una producción de excelente calidad y finos acabados; es por esta razón que tiene proyectos de exportación y ha iniciado los trámites necesarios y ha acumulado los pedidos de varias instituciones que quieren estos productos a fin de capitalizar su inversión.El constante progreso de su negocio la llena de satisfacción y día a día innovan sus diseños y tratan de aplicar nuevas técnicas de tejido en sus mantos y alfombras, ahora también por esa mística de innovación producen chales y mantas para bebés con fibra de alpaca y algodón; sus trabajos son tan finos que son bien cotizados y ellos atienden sólo pedidos. Todos estos esfuerzos son motivados por los deseos de sus cuatro hijos, quienes comprometidos con la empresa familiar desean estudiar carreras afines a la administración, finanzas y exportación con el objetivo de convertirlo en un negocio más competitivo. Graciela solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando las alfombras y demás artículos, con las ganancias podrá satisfacer las necesidades y deseos de sus hijos y además construirá parte de su casa para ampliar su taller de tejidos a telar.Apoyemos a esta pareja de artistas para que sigan progresando y atesorando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for weaving.

loans.name: Edey

texts.es:
Edey is a very hard-working woman. Her sales capabilities have led her to make the decision to open a small grocery store to benefit her community. Before deciding to start this business, she sold cheeses and other dairy products in her country's capital city. She is now very satisfied and excited about the possibility of starting this business in her own home, where she can tend to her son, who is 13 years old and still a minor. Although her husband's abandonment still causes her pain, her strength motivates her to move forward and progress because she hopes to see her son better himself each day.

In order for her wishes to come true, Edey is requesting a loan which she will invest in improving part of the infrastructure of her home so that she can lease it to establish a diner. She will also buy larger amounts and a wider variety of goods for her store. Let’s make her petition possible so that she may continue progressing in the company of her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Edey, es una mujer muy laboriosa, sus habilidades para las ventas la han llevado a que tomar la decisión de aperturar una pequeña tienda de ventas de abarrotes para beneficio de su comunidad, antes de iniciar esta actividad se dedicaba a vender quesos y productos lácteos en la ciudad capital de su país y ahora se siente muy satisfecha y contenta por la posibilidad de emprender este negocio en su propia casa con el que podrá atender las solicitudes que demanda su menor hijo de trece años y aunque el abandono de su esposo aún le causa dolor su fortaleza la motiva a seguir adelante y progresar porque desea ver a su hijo superándose día a día. Para que sus deseos se hagan realidad Edey solicita un préstamo que los invertirá en mejorar parte de la infraestructura de su casa a fin de arrendarla para que establezcan un comedor y también para comprar de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para su tienda. Posibilitemos su petición para que siga progresando en compañía de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Improve part of the infrastructure of her home so that she can offer a room for lease, and buy larger amounts and a wider variety of goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase unfinished coffins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on more merchandise for the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a single mother of small children to whom she wants to teach the value of education as the best avenue for success. She hopes that when they grow up, they'll be hard-working and successful so that she can be proud of the effort that she's making now to earn enough money to send them to school. With that goal in mind, she began selling clothes to her neighbors and friends and, little by little, she's made herself known.

She recently set up a small space in her house where she can store the clothes that she sells and where her customers can come and buy her merchandise. However, she now has too large a supply of summer clothes which she can't sell because her customers are looking for clothes for the coming winter. Rebeca is applying for a US$525 loan so that she can buy merchandise and have new stocks to offer her customers. With your help, Rebeca will be able to help her children and show that she, a single mother, can provide the things they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rebeca es madre soltera de unos pequeños a quienes ella quiere inculcarles que el estudio es la base del éxito y espera que cuando crezcan sus hijos puedan ser personas trabajadoras y que se superen para así ella senrtirse orgulloza de que todo el esfuerzo que está haciendo ahorita por sacar dinero para mandarlos a estudiar valió la pena. Es por eso que comenzó por vender ropa entre sus vecinos y amigos y poco a poco se fue haciendose conocida.

Actualmente hizo un pequeño espacio en su casa para poder colocar la ropa que vende y así poder tener un lugar en dónde la encuentren y le compren mercancía. Sin embargo actualmente tiene mucha ropa de verano y no puede seguir vendiendo esta mercancía puesto que lo que busca la gente en estos momentos es ropa de invierno y es por esto que Rebeca está solicitando un crédito de US $525 para poder comprar mercancía y así tener novedades para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rebeca podrá sacar adelante a sus hijois y demostrarse que ella puede sola con la manutención de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rosa Guadalupe's husband works as a messenger at an accounting firm but his earnings aren't enough to support their four children, aged 1 to 12. They have a lot of expenses: for diapers; for clothes that the growing children quickly outgrow; and for schooling, something especially important to Rosa who wants her children to have a good education so they can get ahead in life.

Rosa sells cosmetics, bought from a catalog, door to door. Little by little, with great effort, Rosa has built a base of customers who regularly order the products they need from her. She now has a request that she can't fill because household expenses have sapped all the money she had. Consequently, she's asking for a US$275 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy the merchandise that's been requested and keep her customers. With your help, Rosa will be able to get ahead and help her children, too.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El esposo de Rosa Guadalupe trabaja como mensajero en una empresa de contadores, sin embargo lo que gana no es suficiente como para mantener a sus cuatro hijos que tienen entre 1 año y 12 años. Por lo tanto tienen muchos gastos como son pañales, ropa puesto que crecen muy rápido y pagarles lo necesario para que estudien puesto que Rosa quiere que sus hijos salgan adelante a base de estudios.

Rosa vende casa por casa cosméticos por catálogo, comenzó a vender este tipo de productos debido que en su casa lo que gana su esposo no alcanza para pagar todo. Y poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Rosa se a ido haciendo de clientes que le piden constantemente los productos que necesitan. Actualmente tiene un pedido que no a podido surtir debido a que los gastos en su casa absorvieron el dinero que tenía guardado. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US$275 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rosa podrá comprar la mercancía que le solicitaron y así no perderá a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá salir adelante y sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Norma Olivia

texts.es:
Norma started her jewelery business 6 years ago to help her husband with household expenses and to provide for their three young children. She sold jewelery through catalogs and amongst friends and acquaintances. After some time and much effort, she was able to build up her customer base made up of her neighbors. She realized that she was becoming known in the region. Now, apart from jewelery, she also sells hamburgers at night.

However, the struggle continues and currently, she has an order for a piece of jewelery that she cannot buy because she lacks the resources for it. Therefore, Norma is requesting a loan of $375, which will be paid back in installments over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy jewelery for this particular order so she can keep her customers happy. With your help, Norma and her family will be able to move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Para poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sis tres pequeños niños. Norma inicio su negocio de venta de joyería hace 6 años comprando catalogos y vendiendo entre amigos y familiares, poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo despues de un tiempo se incremento su clientela con vecinos y se dio cuenta que se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia por lo que ahora aparte de vender joyería por catálogo casa por casa empieza a vender hamburguesas en las noches.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue y actualmente tiene un pedido de joyería que no a podido comprar por falta de recursos es por esto que Norma está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Norma podrá comprar el pedido de joyería para que sus clientes queden satisfechos y le sigan comprando. COn tu ayuda Norma y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy jewelery for a customer order

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge Enrique didn't have many opportunities to find work in his town. "Because there aren't many places to work in the town and I had to work" said Jorge Enrique, explaining why he started working in a general store, organizing, cleaning and placing orders for new inventory. Three years ago, the owner of the store decided to lease the business to Jorge, something that pleased him enormously because with the opportunity to manage the store came the chance to earn more money.

The business has seen good times and bad; for now, there's not enough stock to sell and customers are asking for new things. For this reason, Jorge is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so that he can buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge Enrique no tenía muchas posibilidades de encontrar un buen trabajo en su pueblo. “Por que en el pueblo no hay fuentes de empleo y tenia la necesidad de trabajar” comentó Jorge Enrique, es por eso que comenzó a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes, como la persona que organiza, limpia y hace los pedidos de los materiales que faltan. Sin embargo hace 3 años el dueño de la tienda decidió rentarle el negocio a Jorge, lo cual le gustó mucho puesto que con esta posibilidad de administrarlo él, tendría mayor ganancia.

Sin embargo el negocio a tenido sus temporadas buenas y malas, y en este momento está con poco material para vender y los clientes están pidiendo cosas nuevas. Es por eso que Jorge está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá comprar más mercancía

loans.use: Stock up for Christmas.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela has 3 children, one of whom, sadly, was found to have cancer 6 years ago. It was terrible news. On top of it, and because they were in the hospital with their child, Estela and her husband lost their jobs and were subsequently left without an income. They had no health insurance and had to settle all of the hospital's expenses themselves. In their desperation to find enough money to pay for their son's medicine, Estela and her husband decided to start a business. They applied for a loan so they could buy a machine to make tortillas and, little by little, they began selling them, rising at 4 in the morning so that the tortillas would be ready by 6 when their customers wanted them. They began picking up customers and, sometime later, paid off the loan.

Estela and her husband now have an established business, plus the income from his occasional construction jobs, to pay for their son's medicines. Even so, Estela wants to buy a machine for dividing up the tortilla dough, something that will allow her to make the tortillas faster. Estela is asking for a US$550 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy the machine. With your help, Estela will be able to grow her business so that she can go on paying the costs of treating her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Estela tiene 3 hijos y desgraciadamente hace 6 años le detectaron cáncer a uno de sus pequeños. Lo cual fue una terrible noticia. Aunado a esto y por estar mucho tiempo en el hospital Estela y su esposo perdieron sus trabajos y se quedaron sin ninguna fuente de ingresos, además de que no contaban con seguro médico y todos los gastos tenían que ser corridos por su cuenta. Entre la desesperación de encontrar un negocio que les diera dinero para poder pagar las medicinas de su hijo, y la lucha por encontrar un trabajo nuevo. Estela y su esposo pidieron un préstamo para comprar una máquina para hacer tortillas, poco a poco comenzaron a vender, levantándose a las 4 de la mañana para tener las tortillas listas desde las 6 que es la hora en que los clientes empiezan a buscar este alimento. Poco a poco comenzaron a hacerse de clientes y a pagar lo que les había costado la máquina que ya se terminó de pagar hace tiempo.

Actualmente su esposo y ella tienen este negocio fijo y en ocasiones su esposo tiene trabajos de albañilería para seguir pagando las medicinas de su hijo. Sin embargo Estela desea comprar un equipo que separa la masa para hacer las tortillas y con esto se hará más rápida su producción de tortillas. Estela está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar la maquina. Con tu ayuda Estela podrá crecer su negocio para pagar los gastos que tienen actualmente con su hijo.

loans.use: Buy a machine for making tortillas faster.

loans.name: Lugarda

texts.es:
Lugarda is a woman who looks out for the best interests of her family. Sadly for the family, her husband suffered an accident 3 years ago that led to a long stay in the hospital. Since the expenses of raising 4 children didn't stop while he was injured, Lugarda began to cast around for a business that would allow her to care for both her husband and their children. And that's how she began selling shoes, bought from catalogs, to friends and family. Little by little, while her husband slept and her children studied, Lugarda sold shoes and built a customer base.

Lugarda's husband has managed to recover and is no longer in the hospital, but the struggle to get ahead goes on. For that reason, Lugarda is asking for a loan of US$475, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy more merchandise and give her customers a wider choice of shoes to choose from. With your help, Lugarda will be able to help her children and give them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lugarda es una mujer que siempre ve lo mejor para su familia. Desgraciadamente hace 3 años su esposo sufrió un accidente que lo dejó en el hospital por una larga temporada. Y los gastos de sus 4 hijos no paraban por lo tanto Lugarda decidió comenzar a buscar un negocio que le permitiera seguir cuidando a su esposo que se encontraba en el hospital y al mismo tiempo tener la oportunidad de poder seguir cuidando a sus hijos. Y fue como comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo entre familiares y amigos y poco a poco mientras su esposo dormía y sus hijos estudiaban Lugarda salía a ofrecer zapatos y así fue haciéndose de clientes.

Actualmente su esposo ya no está en el hospital, se pudo recuperar, sin embargo la lucha por salir adelante sigue y es por eso que Lugarda está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Lugarda podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad para que sus clientes escojan entre los diferentes productos. Con tu ayuda Lugarda podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y les dará educación.

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Ever since her husband passed away, Cecilia had to fulfill both parental roles for her children by searching for ways to make enough money to provide well-being and security for her beloved children, who are the reason she can continue vibrantly. She is a hardworking and exemplary mother. From 3AM to 10AM in the morning, she sells nutritious quinoa juice; from midday, after she prepares some food for her dear children, she is busy with manual labor to generate extra income to sustain her family. These activities add up to bring happiness in their lives. In this case, the loan will be used to buy more raw ingredients (sugar, quinoa ) to concoct her tasty, nutritious juices.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que falleció su esposo, doña Cecilia, tuvo que desempeñar los roles de padre y madre para sus hijos, buscando la manera de generar ingresos económicos suficientes para ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos retoños, quienes son la razón por las que se anima a seguir adelante; ella es una laboriosa y ejemplar madre que desde las 3:00 hasta las 10:00 de la mañana se dedicada a vender sus nutritivos jugos de quinua y a partir del medio día, después de preparar los respectivos alimentos para sus amorosos hijos, desempeña su noble labor artesanal, trabajo que le genera ingresos económicos adicionales para su sustento familiar, estas actividades vienen atesorando mucha satisfacción en su vida.La solicitud que en esta oportunidad hace le permitirá comprar materia prima (azúcar, quinua), a fin de seguir preparando sus agradables y nutritivos jugos.

loans.use: To buy sugar and quinoa to make nutritious juices

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dani is a hardworking 23 year old entrepreneur. For seven years she has worked in the marketing of wool from alpacas and sheep. She began this work with the unconditional support of her mother and now, thanks to her diligence and perseverance, she has come out on top. This young woman buys skins in the different villages near her home town of Juliaca, which she later shears the wool from and sells to textile business. Currently, due to the large quantity of demand, Dani sees the need to request our assistance through the provision of a loan. This loan will allow her to increase the capital she can invest and with the added profits she will help her mother provide for the education of her two younger siblings. Dani hopes for our assistance in order to continue to prosper and continue manifesting her desires to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Dani, es una emprendedora y trabajadora muchacha de 23 años de edad, desde hace 7 años se dedica a la comercialización de lana de alpaca y oveja, trabajo que emprendió con el apoyo incondicional de su madre y que ahora gracias a su perseverancia y diligencia viene sacando adelante.Esta joven muchacha, compra los cueros en los diferentes pueblos aledaños a su ciudad natal, Juliaca, para luego trasquilarlos y venderlos a una empresa textil. Ahora debido a la gran cantidad de pedidos y solicitudes que tiene se vio en la necesidad de solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo le permitirá incrementar su capital de inversión, y con las ganancias que obtenga apoyar a su madre en la educación de sus dos hermanos menores.Dani, espera por vuestra colaboración, para prosperar y seguir acogiendo en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to fulfill the each order received.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more and better unfinished pieces of furniture

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
We find 19-year-old Luzgarda in the company of her adorable 3-month-old baby. She is a hard-working mother who, since she was 17 years old, worked several different jobs to save enough and realize her dream of starting her own business running a small grocery store, which at the beginning, she ran in a small area in the home of her loving mother, Peregrina. Now, after much effort and dedication, her little store has turned into one of the biggest and most visited of the small town of Santa Lucia.

The dream of this young mother is to one day own a chain of wholesale grocery distribution stores. For this reason, she also studies accounting and computer skills in an institution of higher learning in her town, so that in the future she may adequately administer her chain of stores. In this opportunity, Luzgarda resorts to your support and requests a loan with which she intends to increase the variety of her goods while supporting her young husband to finish his military career with the hope that they can one day enjoy an environment filled with love, unity and tranquility in their new home. Let’s support this young lady with great entrepreneurial spirit to continue harboring in her heart wishes of improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Luzgarda de 19 años de edad en compañía de su adorable bebé de tres meses. Ella es una laboriosa madre que desde la edad de 17 años trabajó en diferentes oficios para ahorrar lo suficiente con el sueño de emprender su negocio propio con una bodeguita de abarrotes, negocio que en principio funcionaba en un pequeño espacio del domicilio de su querida madre, Peregrina, ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación su pequeño centro de ventas se ha convertido en uno de los más grandes y concurridos de su pueblito Santa Lucia.El deseo de esta joven madre es poseer algún día una cadena de tiendas de distribución de abarrotes al por mayor, es por esa razón que también estudia “contabilidad y computación” en un instituto superior de su pueblo, para en un futuro administrar adecuadamente su cadena de tiendas; en esta oportunidad Luzgarda recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo con el que pretende aumentar la variedad de su mercadería y al mismo tiempo apoyar a su joven esposo a concluir su carrera militar a fin de que juntos puedan gozar de un ambiente de amor, unión y tranquilidad en su nuevo hogar.Apoyemos a esta joven con gran espíritu emprendedor a que siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: Increase the amount and variety of goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Here in their small bicycle repair shop, in a district far outside of Puno, we find Mrs. Esther C. C. and her entrepreneurial husband, Santos. This hardworking couple has dedicated themselves to this noble service for more than six years. Thanks to the good service that they provide their shop is gaining a regular clientele. In addition to the repair shop the family raises cattle and alpacas which provide important revenues through the marketing of calves.

The desire of Esther and her self sacrificing husband is to expand their repair shop and to sell spare parts for motorcycles and cars. In order to make their plans more concrete they are requesting a loan. This money they will use to provide for the security and well-being of their three young children who are the couples motivation to work and struggle forward each day.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

En uno de los distritos más lejanos de la ciudad de Puno, encontramos a Doña Esther y su emprendedor esposo, Santos, en su pequeño taller de reparación de bicicletas. Esta laboriosa pareja desempeña esta noble labor desde hace siete años, trabajo que gracias al buen servicio que presta está obteniendo asiduos clientes; adicionalmente esta familia se dedica a la crianza de animales (vacas y alpacas), que les otorga ingresos económicos muy importantes al comercializar sus pequeños terneritos. El deseo de Doña Esther y su abnegado esposo es ampliar su taller y vender repuestos de motos y carros. Para concretar sus planes solicitan un préstamo, dinero que les permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos y a través de el obtener mayores beneficios económicos para brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus tres menores hijos, quienes son la razón por la que se esfuerzan y trabajan a diario.

loans.use: Purchase of spare motorcyle and car parts which will be sold in their small repair shop.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Mrs. Noemi C. C. D. A. and her husband, Hermenegildo, maintain their strength and drive despite the difficult times after the painful loss of their baby. They continue to progress so that they can proviD. for the well-being of their remaining five children who are all of school age. These exempliary parents dedicate themselves to the raising and selling alpacas. Each Sunday in the small town of Ocuviri Noemi sells a diverse selection of clothing in the street fair. The diversity of her wares helps her to earn good revenues. The added revenue helps to satisfy the necessities of her home.

Noemi’s great wish is to further increase the variety and stock of her products so that she can proviD. for the betterment and studies of her children. This is the invaluable inheritance that these humble parents wish to leave to their children. With our help they will be able to.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Noemí y su esposo, Hermenegildo, a pesar D. los momentos muy difíciles que vienen pasando por la penosa pérdida D. su pequeño, aún conservan el ímpetu y ánimo D. progresar para otorgarles bienestar a los cinco pequeños que aún tiene en casa y en etapa escolar. Estos ejemplares padres se dedican a la crianza y comercialización D. alpacas, y los domingos días D. feria del pueblito D. Ocuviri, Noemí venD. en forma ambulatoria diversas prendas D. vestir, negocio que por la diversidad D. su mercadería le viene otorgando satisfacción ya que le permite obtener buenos ingresos económicos para la satisfacción D. las necesidades y deseos D. su hogar.El anhelo D. Noemí es acrecentar la variedad y el stock D. su mercadería con el objetivo D. complacer los deseos D. superación y estudios D. sus queridos hijos, ya que ésta se convertirá en la valiosísima herencia que estos humildes padres pretenden dejar a sus hijos. Con vuestro apoyo lo podrán lograr.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger selection of clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria comes from a large family of humble means. At the age of 17, she was forced her to become independent. Since then, she has worked hard to get ahead, and bears the added responsibility of caring for her three young children. Upon witnessing the growing necessities of her home, she decided to open a small grocery store in her in-laws’ house, a business that she is slowly implementing and with which she is satisfying her family’s needs. In addition to this job, on Sundays, this hardworking mother sells various goods at the Ocuviri fair, a business that also generates good income and with which she can contribute more to her family’s welfare. Gloria wishes to increase the quantity and variety of goods of daily necessity that she offers in her small shop in order to satisfy her growing clientele. She would like to increase her profits, and in this way, provide security and wellbeing for her beloved children. Let us help improve Gloria’s family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Doña Gloria, proviene de una amplia y humilde familia; a la edad de 17 años la necesidad la obligó a independizarse, desde entonces trabaja arduamente para progresar y salir adelante, ahora ya con la responsabilidad que le demanda el cuidado de sus tres menores hijos. Al observar que las necesidades de su hogar se iban incrementando, decidió aperturar en el domicilio de sus suegros una bodeguita de abarrotes, negocio que poco a poco está implementando y con el cual está satisfaciendo plenamente las necesidades de su familia.Adicionalmente a este trabajo, los domingos días de feria de su pueblo natal, Ocuviri, esta laboriosa madre se dedica a la venta de mercerías, negocio que también viene generándole buenos ingresos económicos y con el que puede contribuir adicionalmente para el bienestar de su hogar.El deseo de Gloria es aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos de primera necesidad que ofrece en su pequeña bodeguita, para seguir satisfaciendo a su exigente clientela, con el propósito de acrecentar sus beneficios económicos y así ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos retoños. Contribuyamos para mejorar la condición de vida de la familia de Gloria.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity and variety of goods of daily necessity to sell in a small grocery store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
We enter and find Gladys, mother of two babies, cleaning her humble home. Thanks to her perseverance and willingness to supervise, she has progressed in the business of sale of French fries. In addition to this demanding job, Mrs. Gladys dedicates herself to the marketing of beef and alpaca meat. After buying them in her home town of Ocuviri, she distributes them in different markets near the city where she lives. This enterprise is the primary source of income for her family. Gladys, a happy and enterprising mother, only has one wish—to obtain more capital to invest in her business of meat marketing. She requests a loan with which she will try to obtain greater profits through investment. Let us help this mother improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Encontramos a Gladys, haciendo la limpieza de su humilde hogar, ella es madre de dos niños que gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de superación vienen progresando en su compañía con el negocio de venta de salchipapas (papas fritas con salchichas).Adicionalmente a este trabajo que diariamente desempeña, Doña Gladys se dedica a la comercialización de carne de res y alpaca, que luego de comprarlas en su pueblo natal, Ocuviri, las distribuye en los diferentes mercados aledaños a su ciudad, esta actividad es el principal ingreso económico con el que cuenta esta familia para satisfacer sus necesidades.El deseo de Gladys, madre alegre y emprendedora, es obtener mayor capital para invertir en su negocio de comercialización de carne; para esto solicita un préstamo con el que pretende obtener mayores beneficios económicos después de su inversión y vuestra ayuda. Ayudemos a esta madre a que mejoré cada día la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Capital investment for business of selling delicious meats.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
49 year old Mrs. Juana and her husband Paulino are mainly dedicated to growing livestock, but at the same time, offer exterior painting and battery charging services to their small community, jobs that have brought them additional economic deposits for supporting their family. The wish of this selfless mother is to provide her four young sons the opportunity to study for a professional career. This is an opportunity that she never had. At a very young age, Mrs. Juanita was left an orphan and did not rely on sufficient economic resources to embark on her current path. Since then she has had to work arduously to support herself. Mrs. Juanita asks a loan to buy raw material (paint) with the goal of continuing to provide her services. Juana has placed her hopes in you.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Doña Juana, de 49 años de edad y su esposo, Paulino, están dedicados a la crianza de ganado y al mismo tiempo a ofrecer sus servicios de pintado de fachadas y carga de baterías a la población en general de su pequeña comunidad, oficios que les viene generando ingresos económicos adicionales para el sustento de su querida familia.El deseo que tiene esta abnegada madre es brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional para que puedan cumplir cada una de las metas que se han trazado sus cuatro queridos hijos menores, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo porque a muy corta edad quedó huérfana y no contaba con recursos económicos suficientes para emprender el camino que se había trazado; desde entonces tuvo que trabajar arduamente para auto sostenerse.Doña Juanita solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima (pintura) con el objetivo de seguir brindando sus servicios. Juana tiene depositada sus esperanzas en vosotros.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity of paint to continue with her labor and to embellish the houses of her city.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue buying fruits and invest in a new refrigerator

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
We meet Esperanza, a young, a 21-year-old enterprising mother, who makes a variety of breads, an occupation she has inherited from her beloved grandparents who now, thanks to her perseverance and diligence, continue thriving. While she eagerly dedicates herself to this work, her husband, Raúl, has decided to leave his hometown, Ocuviri, to search of better opportunities to get some savings to finally build a house, a home of his own in which he hopes will give his three beloved children security, well-being, and comfort so they can grow up well. Esperanza’s wish is to repair her small bakery and increase the amount and variety of her production to satisfy the large demand of her clients and to fulfill these plans she asks for a loan with which she’ll be able to get her wish and satisfy her demanding clients with her delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Encontramos a Esperanza madre joven y emprendedora de 21 años, elaborando una gran variedad de panes, negocio que heredó de sus queridos abuelitos y que ahora con el que gracias a su perseverancia y diligencia viene progresando.Mientras ella se dedica ha este oficio con mucho ahínco, su esposo, Raúl, ha decidido salir de su pueblo natal, Ocuviri, en busca de mejores oportunidades con el objetivo de amasar algunos ahorros para finalmente construir su casita, morada propia en la que pretenden brindar a sus tres queridos hijos seguridad, bienestar y comodidad para que puedan desarrollarse plenamente.El deseo de Esperanza es refaccionar su pequeña panadería y aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su producción para cubrir la gran demanda de sus clientes y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo dinero con el que podrá concretar su deseo y seguirá satisfaciendo a su exigente clientela con sus deliciosos panes.

loans.use: The repair of the equipment in a small bakery.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es:
Here at his small workstation, which shares space with his grocery store, we find Mr. Ciriaco C. eagerly vending his services as a radio technician. While he awaits new clients for radio repair, this father works selflessly from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm attending to clients in the grocery store. Ciriaco started this business along with his wife, Flora. His workshop is in high demand due to the fact that it is the only one in Ciriaco’s home since birth, Ocuviri.

Ciriaco’s desires to offer better and faster service have brought Ciriaco to request our assistance. With the loan that you can provide him he will be able to earn greater revenues. With these he will be able to cover the cost of studies for his four oldest children. Let us make it possible for this noble father to earn, through his work as a radio technician, enough to provide for the wellbeing of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a don Ciriaco, brindando afanosamente sus servicios de radiotecnia, en un pequeño tallercito que funciona en un espacio de su tienda de abarrotes; este abnegado padre desempeña su labor desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, adicionalmente a este trabajo se dedica a atender su tiendita de abarrotes mientras espera la llegada de solicitudes de sus clientes, este negocio lo emprendió junto a su esposa Flora.El tallercito con el que cuenta actualmente es muy concurrido, puesto que es el único que existe en su pueblo natal, Ocuviri, y sus deseos de implementar y ofrecer un mejor y rápido servicio a sus clientes lo llevan a solicitar de vuestro apoyo. A fin de que la solicitud que te extiende le genere buenos ingresos económicos que permitan cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus cuatro hijos menores. Hagamos posible que este noble padre a través de su ocupación pueda generarles bienestar a su querida familia.

loans.use: Implementation of the only radio repair shop in Ocuviri.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina is a young 21 year old entrepreneur and her whole family has always worked in the sale of wool, a business that thanks to the sacrifice she has put into the business they began, little by little, to make it a profitable one, to the point where they have established themselves as a reliable business in the local area where they live. This hard-working family has to travel extensively collecting the raw materials, and thanks to this traveling they are able to satisfy a fair share of customer demand where they live. This is why they are asking for a loan: they will increase their income and improve their financial situation business, and will use the profits to pay for higher education for the youngest members of the family. Your loan will be wisely spent in this family.

Toda la familia de Luz Marina, joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, siempre se dedicó a la comercialización de lana, negocio que a fuerza de mucho sacrificio y empeño poco a poco fueron sacando adelante, y que ahora los ha convertido en los comerciantes más solicitados en su campo laboral, permitiéndoles así cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar.Esta empeñosa familia recorre varias horas en su pequeña movilidad con el fin de juntar la cantidad necesaria de esta mercadería para su comercialización; gracias a su empeño y diligencia van albergando una gran variedad de pedidos y es por esa razón que solicitan un préstamo que les permitirá incrementar y mejorar su situación económica y sobre todo ofrecerles estudios superiores a los dos miembros más pequeños de su familia.Tu préstamo será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of a greater quantity and variety of wool to consolidate the small business of its sale.

Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de lana para consolidar el pequeño negocio de comercialización.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
We find Doris, in the company of her dear mother Gregoria, realizing her beautiful, colored, and elegant embroidered tapestries. She began creating this beautiful art two years ago, a trade she learned from her brother Walter. With the passing of time she perfected her embroidery technique that is now increasingly valued and asked for by the large number of clients. This enterprising and agile girl desires to continue expanding her products in the market. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan that she will invest in buying materials to continue embroidering and offering the best of her art. The economic benefits that she will obtain will provide her old and beloved mother with a better quality of life. At the moment, Doris hopes for your contribution so that she can continue to delight her select clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Andrew Tsavaris, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Encontramos a Doris, en compañía de su querida madre Gregoria, realizando sus hermosos, coloridos y elegantes cuadros bordados, ella incursionó en este bello arte desde hace dos años, oficio que aprendió de su hermano Walter y con el correr del tiempo fue perfeccionando su técnica de bordados y que ahora están siendo cada vez más cotizados por la gran cantidad de clientes y pedidos que alberga. Esta emprendedora y ágil muchacha desea seguir expandiendo sus productos en el mercado y es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en comprar materiales y materia prima para seguir bordando y ofreciendo lo mejor de su arte, con los beneficios económicos que obtenga brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su anciana y querida madre. En estos momentos Doris espera por tu colaboración para que siga deleitando con su bello arte a su selecta clientela.

loans.use: Purchase raw material to continue making her beautiful tapestries.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Mrs. Celestina and her enterprising husband, Meliton, left their home town of Capachica with their six small children in search of a better future. Currently, Meliton provides moving services with his motor taxi. For her part, Celestina dedicates herself to the marketing of sheep. With much effort and perseverance, they succeeded in constructing their small dwelling in the city of Juliaca where they currently reside, with the goal of providing their small children a loving home. This pair of entrepreneurs, in search of a prosperous life, wish to increase their capital in order to invest in their business of marketing sheep livestock, which by December will be under great demand. The pair already works arduously with the sole intention of providing their children a future as professionals. We seek to fulfill their request so that the wishes of these loving parents can be quickly realized.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Doña Celestina y su emprendedor esposo, Meliton, salieron de su pueblo natal, Capachica, en compañía de sus seis hijos pequeños en busca de un mejor porvenir. Actualmente Meliton brinda servicios de movilidad urbana a la población con su pequeña herramienta de trabajo un mototaxi; por su parte Celestina se dedica a la comercialización de ganado (ovino) y entre ambos con mucho esfuerzo y tesón lograron construir su pequeña morada en la ciudad donde radican ahora, Juliaca, con el fin de albergar amorosamente a sus pequeños niños.El deseo que tiene esta emprendedora pareja, con muchísimas ganas de prosperar en la vida, es incrementar su capital, para invertirlos en su negocio de comercialización de ganado, que por el mes de diciembre va teniendo gran demanda ya que ellos trabajan arduamente con un único prepósito, de observar en un futuro a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.Posibilitemos su petición para que los anhelos de estos queridos padres puedan concretarse en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Capital injection for purchase and sale of sheep to accumulate funds that will allow the owners to save money and make future investments.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Teresa has a business in the central market in Leon. She sells natural drinks, sodas, juices, purified water, cookies, etc. She has been working this business for 18 years, having started with $6 dollars for the sugar and the fruits to make her first sales. Her mother also had a restaurant and encouraged her to start the refresquería (beverage store, juice stand).

Maria Teresa was a housewife, even though she has not children, she helps her mother and father financially. Her loans are for investing in her business, buying the different products she sells there. She has been working with loans for 3 years, and has had 16 loans. This is a way for her to support her business, and has allowed her to increase her inventory and working capital for the benefit of her business. She feels very thankful for the help she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Teresa tiene un negocio en el Mercado Central de Leon, vende refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos, agua purificada, galletas...etc. Tiene 18 años trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con 6 dólares para el azucar y las frutas y hacer sus primeras ventas. Su mamá tennia comidería y la indujo a poner al refresqueria.

Ella era ama de casa, aunque no tiene hijos, ayuda economicamente a su mamá y a su papá, sus créditos son para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los diferentes productos que ahi vende. LLeva 3 años trabajando con los créditos,ha tenido 16 créditos y esto es para ella una manera de mantener su negocio, le ha permitido aumentar su inventario y capital de trabajo para el beneficio del negocio, se siente bien agradecida por la ayuda que recibe.

loans.use: Working capital (buying fruits and merchandise for juice store) (Capital de Trabajo)

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña Concepcion sells fruits such as bananas, oranges, pineapple, papaya, in addition to sodas, juices, water, candy, cookies, cigarettes, etc.

She has been working in this business for 9 years and remembers how she started with US$11 of her own money when she found herself alone after separating from her husband. The need to support her 3 children motivated her to look for a way to make money to be able to guarantee food and education for the children. She started selling in the streets, door to door, but thanks to the help she has received in loans, she was able to establish herself in the central market of Leon. She started investing in the business and she has seen she has achieves financial stability and growth little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Concepcion vende frutas como bananos, naranjas, piña, papaya, ademas de gaseosas, jugos, agua, caramelos, galletas, cigarrillos....etc.

Lleva 9 años de tener este negocio y recuerda que comenzo con 11 dólares, de dinero propio, al quedarse sola por la separacion de su esposo y la necesidad de mantener a sus 3 hijos la indujo a buscar una manera de ganarse el dinero para poder asegurar la comida y educacion para los niños. Comenó vendiendo en la calle de puerta a puerta pero gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido con los créditos, consiguió establecerse en el Mercado Central de Leon, comenzó poco a poco a invertir en el negocio y ha visto que ha logrado estabilidad y crecimiento económico poco a poco.

loans.use: working capital; buying fruits (Capital de Trabajo, compra de frutas)

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Mrs. Modesta sells national arts and crafts such as paintings, traditional dresses, wooden decorations, etc.

She has been working in this business for 22 years and remembers how she started with US$107 of her own money. Before establishing herself in a location, she sold in the floor at the central market in Leon. She sold children's toys. Thanks to the help she is receiving, she has been able to diversify her products and her sales have improved, allowing her to have better profits. Even though her children are grown, she has 3 grandchildren she takes care of, and she contributes to their education and to feed them. What she has received is good, because it has allowed her to have a variety of products and to invest a lot in the high seasons such as Christmas and other special occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Modesta vende artesania nacional como, cuadros, trajes típicos, adornos de madera...etc

Lleva 22 años de tener este negocio y recuerda que comenzo con 107 dólares, de dinero propio, antes de establecerse en el tramo, vendia en el suelo del mercado central de leon, comenzó vendiendo jugetes para niños. Gracias a la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ha logrado diversificar sus productos y la venta ha mejorado, permitiendole tener mejores ganancias. A pesar de que sus hijos estan mayores, tiene 3 nietos a su cargo, y ella les da para la educacion y la alimentacion. Lo que recibe ha sido bueno, pues le ha permitido tener una variedad en sus productos,invertir bastante en las temporadas altas como la navidad y otras fechas especiales.

loans.use: Working capital (buying arts and crafts to sell at market) (Capital de Trabajo)

loans.name: Elia Maritza

texts.es:
Doña Elia has a small store in the central market in Leon. She sells spices that are part of the ingredients for the traditional dishes in Nicaragua, for example: vinegar, achiote, salsas, mustard, etc.

She has been working on this business for 10 years. She started with C$1,500 (about US$100), this from a loan from CEPRODEL. Little by little she has been able to maintain her module at the market and this has allowed her to attract more customers. She needs to invest in her working capital and to buy the merchandise she offers. She has achieved better quality of life for herself and her mother. The help has benefited her because now she can buy cash from her providers, at a better price, to obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Elia tiene una tiendita en el Mercado Central de Leon, vende especies que son parte de los ingredientes para los platillos de comida típicos en Nicaragua, un ejemplo de ello es: El vinagre, achiote, Salsas, mostaza etc.

Lleva 10 años trabajando con este negocio, comenzo con C$ 1,500 ( casi $ 100 dolares), esto de un prestamo que sacó en CEPRODEL. Poco a poco ha logrado darle mantenimiento al Módulo que tiene y esto le ha permitido atraer a mas clientela. Ella necesita invertir en su capital de trabajo y para la compra de la mercaderia que ofrece. Ha logrado tener una mejor condicion de vida para ella y para su mamá, la ayuda le ha beneficiado porque ahora compra al contado a sus proveedores y a un mejor precio para obtener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Buying spices to sell at the market. (Venta de Especies para alimentos)

loans.name: Rosa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Rosa sells in the central market in Leon, sandals for girls, boys and adults; shoes for women and men of all ages, etc.

She has been working in this business for 7 years and remembers she started with US$108 of her own money. She started with the necessity to not be walking every day, selling door to door, because she had a health problem. But this did not make her lose heart, she continues selling and is proud of having been able to make it to where she is right now.

Right now she is more financially stable and her children always have food for three meals a day. The impact of the aid received has been very good for her business and for herself as a person because she can see how others encourage her to go on.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Rosa vende en el mercado central de Leon, sandalias para niñas, niños y adultos, calzado para damas y caballero de todas las edades...etc.

Lleva 7 años de tener este negocio y recuerda que comenzo con 108 dólares, de dinero propio. Inicia con la necesidad de no estar caminando diario vendiendo de casa en casa, porque se le presentó un problema de salud...pero esto no la desanimó, ella sigue vendiendo y está orgullo se haber logrado llegar a donde esta ahora....

Se encuentra mas estable economicamente y sus hijos siempre tienen alimento para los 3 tiempos de comida. El impacto de la ayuda que ha recibido ha sido muy bueno para su negocio y para ella como persona porque mira que los demas la animan a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Working capital, buying merchandise (shoes). (Capital de Trabajo, compra de productos para la venta)

loans.name: Soila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Soila gets her products from the distributors at Chinandega, she travels to Managua, and what she sells is a daily use product aside from cosmetics. She has been able to get into the market of basic grains, such as beans, rice, oil, etc.

She has been working for 15 years in this business, starting with US$54 of her own money. She started with the need to have a home and give her children a good quality of life. She started selling thread, hair irons, and silk. She had to immigrate to Panama to work hard and save money to continue her business here, in Nicaragua. Her business has been growing little by little, and she now has a good clientele in the central market of Leon and would like to grow more to have more profit and be able to sell her children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Soila obtiene sus productos de los distribuidores de Chinandega, viaja a Managua y lo que vende es un producto de consumo diario, aparte de los cosméticos ha logrado abrirse al mercado de los granos básicos como frijoles, arro, aceite,. etc.

Lleva 15 años trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con 54 dólares de su propio dinero., inicia con la necesidad de tener un hogar y darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, comenzó vendiendo hilos, prensadores de pelo, seda. Tuvo que imigrar a Panamá para trabajar mucho y ahorrar para continuar con su negocio aqui en Nicaragua. Su negocio va creciendo poco a poco, ya tiene buena clientela en el mercado central de Leon y desea crecer mas para tener ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de Mercaderia)

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
Justo Pastor sells clothes, electrical household items, stuffed toy animals, pillows, toys, vases, towels, shoes... practically everything. They even have the drive to sell basic grains.

He has been working this business for 15 years, starting with $54 of his own money. He started with the need to help out his mom, remembering how before, when he was a boy, he would go out with her to sell in the streets door to door. Later, they were able to establish themselves in one of the sidewalks in the central market of Leon, selling watches, cosmetics and small things.
