Amelia inicia su jornada de trabajo muy temprano en la mañana, hora en que se dedica a cuidar sus cultivos con abonos y al término de esta labor se dispone rápidamente a atender en su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes, negocio que instauró con afán para sostenerse mientras espera la cosecha de sus deliciosos productos.El deseo que tiene es acrecentar mucho más su negocio para distribuir sus productos también en la ciudad de Pichanaki y en los diferentes mercados de los departamentos de su país y así generar mayores ingresos económicos para cubrir los estudios que dentro de poco tiempo iniciarán sus queridos hijos, por esa razón solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos. Contribuyamos con esta dedicada madre para que siga forjando en su hogar un futuro prominente para sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY OF SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO EXPAND THE BUSINESS, INCREASE INCOME, AND BETTER PREPARE FOR THE COSTS OF EDUCATING HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben is an animated young man filled with enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling food in a small space he rents. He has big plans and dreams to grow his business. Since he was very young, he learned a great deal about food preparation from his mother and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. His goal is to have his own place where he can offer more comforts to his customers, and he'd like to buy a refrigerator so he can begin to offer cold drinks as well. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts, and your important contribution, he can reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva volunteer.

Rubén, es un joven lleno de optimismo y ánimo que se dedica íntegramente a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto que alquila para este fin y que le ha proporcionado inmensos planes y deseos de superación. Él recibió desde niño muchas enseñanzas valiosas respecto a la cocina, razón por la que ha decidido dedicarse a esta actividad en su localidad, dándose de lleno y aplicando lo que aprendió gracias a su laboriosa madre. Su anhelo es tener su propio local para ofrecer mayores comodidades a su exigente clientela en el que pueda expender también bebidas frías con una refrigeradora que piensa comprar. Es por ello que con un corazón lleno de optimismo se esfuerza al máximo en la preparación de sus potajes para así mejorar los ingresos económicos de este año. Con su esfuerzo, dedicación y sobre todo nuestra importante contribución logrará la realización de cada uno de sus sueños.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR SO HE CAN OFFER HIS CUSTOMERS COLD DRINKS ALONG WITH THE MEALS HE SERVES, GROWING HIS BUSINESS AND INCREASING HIS INCOME.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a loving and hard working mother. Even though her family has had difficulties due to poverty, she has always tried hard and worked hard to support her family and keep them moving forward. Esperanza runs a small shop where she sells various items needed for every day. She works every day of the week to serve the people in her community. She is also taking care of her young grandchildren, as well as her oldest son who needed a stomach operation recently and now needs a lot of care and help with his children. Her goal now is to grow her small business and increase the number of products she offers, expanding her customer base and increasing her income. This will enable her to improve the health and the quality of life for her family. She is requesting a loan to help her reach her goals. You can be an important part of the growth of her business.

Doña Esperanza, es una mujer muy abnegada, cariñosa y laboriosa, está a cargo de dos de sus hijos y aunque en su familia haya momentos difíciles a causa de la pobreza, ella se ha esforzado y ha trabajado más para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en el que comercializa diversos productos de primera necesidad para toda su comunidad durante todos los días de la semana.Así mismo se encarga del cuidado de sus pequeños nietos ya que su hijo mayor fue operado de un quiste en el estómago hace poco y necesita de muchos cuidados y ayuda con sus pequeños. Ahora su meta próxima es ampliar la infraestructura de su pequeño puesto de trabajo con el deseo de aumentar la pluralidad de los productos que brinda, a fin de mejorar sus servicios e incrementar la cantidad de clientes para obtener mayores ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar la salud y nivel de vida de su familia. Y para concretar este anhelo solicita un préstamo. Vosotros podeis ser parte importante del crecimiento de este negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INCREASE THE STOCK IN HER SMALL SHOP AND GROW HER CUSTOMER BASE, INCREASE HER INCOME AND BETTER CARE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
Maria is 23 years old and comes from a large and humble family. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. This became even more critical when her husband abondoned her and their three children. Because of this, and with the experience she had gained working in different jobs since she was very young, she was able to develop her business raising small animals, such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She raises them in her house, and with the income she generates she is able to take care of her children and provide them with a better quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals so that she can grow her business and continue to improve their standard of living. With your help, this dedicated mother will be able to reach her goals.

María, tiene 23 años de edad, proviene de una familia numerosa y humilde, las circunstancias difíciles y duras de la vida hicieron que conociera desde muy pequeña el valor propio del trabajo, aún más cuando su esposo la abandonó y se marchó de casa y dejándola desamparada con sus tres pequeños hijos. A raíz de estos hechos y de la experiencia que adquirió en diversas ocupaciones desde muy pequeña se desenvuelve sin ningún problema en sus actividades cotidianas; actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animalitos como gallinas, cuyes y cerditos, este trabajo lo realiza en su casa y con el ingreso que le genera le brinda una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijitos quienes son su mayor alegría. Solicita un préstamo para comprar más animales pequeños y luego venderlos cuando alcancen su etapa de comercialización; así mismo cree que con esta inversión podrá incrementar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida. Solidaricémonos con los sueños de esta dedicada madre para que pueda alcanzar sus sueños en corto tiempo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A GREATER NUMBER OF ANIMALS SUCH AS CHICKENS, PIGS AND GUINEA PIGS, GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER THREE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is an enterprising woman who works hard every day in her shop to help her family. She decided to begin this business because her husband abandoned her and their young children two years ago, leaving them without any support. In her ongoing efforts to progress forward, she would like to increase the variety and quality of the products she offers, growing her business into a larger operation in a well stocked location. She is requesting a loan to help grow the business. In this way, she will get closer and closer to her goals. Let's help her in her efforts to improve the quality of life for her children.

Hilda, es una mujer emprendedora que cada día gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que pone en su tienda de venta de artículos para el hogar ha satisfecho eficientemente las necesidades de su familia. Ella decidió dedicarse a esta labor debido a la gran necesidad que existía en su casa, ya que su esposo la abandonó hace dos años, dejando a sus dos menores hijos sin ningún amparo y totalmente desconsolados, fue así como se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos.En su continuo afán de progreso desea incrementar la calidad y variedad de sus productos para dejar de realizarlo en pequeña magnitud y empezar a desarrollar su labor a gran escala contando para este propósito con un local adecuado. Para emprender este sueño desea comprar mayor cantidad de pequeños artículos y solicita un préstamo. De esta manera poco a poco irá incrementando su capital de inversión e irá cristalizando sus anhelos. Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Hilda siga forjando con su esfuerzo y amor los sueños de sus hijitos.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS SO THAT SHE CAN GROW AND INCREASE HER INCOME.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER, HER GOAL IS TO  PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER TWO CHILDREN.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a hardworking, enterprising and dedicated father. He learned carpentry when he was just three years old, thanks to his dear father. Now he has developed this talent, putting his creativity into each piece he makes. One of his main motivations for working so hard each day are his children. His work fills him with satisfaction and his plans for the future have grown. Edgar would like to sell his work on a much larger scale, sending his high quality pieces to Huancayo where his mother lives. They've decided to work together to expand his business. He would like to continue supporting his family and improving their quality of life. He is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of wood in order to realize his goals, increase his income and the well being of his children. Let's help this talented and hardworking father in his efforts.

Edgar, es un padre de familia muy abnegado y trabajador, como padre emprendedor que es se dedica a la carpintería desde hace tres años, él aprendió a trabajar la madera con la mano desde niño gracias a las enseñanzas de su querido padre y ahora ha desarrollado este talento poniendo su creatividad en cada trabajo que realiza.Actualmente es padre de un hijo que lo motiva día a día a trabajar diligentemente. Su desempeño diario lo llena de satisfacción y sus planes para el futuro se han incrementado.Edgar desea comercializar madera a gran escala, enviando una muy buena cantidad hacia Huancayo donde vive su mamá, con quien ha decidido asociarse para iniciar su comercialización en gran cantidad. Desea seguir apoyando a su familia y desarrollándose a través de esta actividad, es por ello que solicita un préstamo que le servirá para comprar mayor cantidad de madera para la realización de sus planes e incrementará sus ingresos para brindarles bienestar a sus hijos. Apoyemos a un padre que con talento y esfuerzo vela por su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS CARPENTRY BUSINESS AND GROW IT TO A MUCH LARGER OPERATION, INCREASING HIS INCOME AND IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HIS CHILDREN.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charo is a hard working and virtuous woman who works everyday to improve the quality of life of her home; and although there have been many financially difficult times as result of a robbery years ago, her optimism has helped her overcome them and start several businesses such as growing crops on her small farm and raising small farm animals to sell. All this has made her very happy as she’s been able to attain some financial stability and cover all the household necessities, thanks in part to knowledge she’s acquired since childhood. Her hard work has motivated her desire to buy more land to produce larger fruit crops. Charo has focused each and every one of her efforts towards this wish and she is conscious that with more effort and dedication she’ll make it a reality. She asks for a loan to buy more necessary products to guarantee a good harvest. With your collaboration, she’ll be able to fulfill her dreams in short order.

p>Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Charo, es una mujer esforzada y virtuosa que cada día se esfuerza por incrementar la calidad de vida de su hogar y aunque ha existido muchos momentos de carencia económica, producto de un terrible robo que sufrió hace años atrás, su optimismo la ha ayudado a superarlos realizando una serie de actividades; como el cultivo de diversos productos en su chacrita y la venta de los animalitos que cría; todo esto la ha puesto muy optimista porque ha podido lograr cierta tranquilidad económica que le permite cubrir las necesidades más necesarias de su hogar, gracias al conocimiento que fue adquiriendo desde niña. Su desempeño la ha motivado a tener un gran anhelo y es el de poder comprar mayor cantidad de tierras en el que pretende producir mayor cantidad de frutas.Doña Charo ha centrado todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos en este deseo y ella es consciente que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá hacerlo realidad; solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de más productos indispensables para una buen producción. Con vuestra importante colaboración ella podrá cumplir en poco tiempo sus anhelos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to optimize fruit production and raising of farm animals.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio is man that even at sixty years old still radiates optimism, even though the economic hardships he’s endured have depressed him at times. He works incessantly to help all members of his large family, especially for the development of the young grandchildren that live with him. Daily living requires a necessary amount of money, for this reason Lucio works tirelessly on his small farm cultivating various products and taking care of his animals both of which are sold at the local market. He also sells his products in a little kiosk to supplement the family income. He wishes to upgrade the kiosk as well as improve his agricultural products in hopes of improving his dear wife’s health which has deteriorated with the passage of time. With the desire of watching is family’s standard of living improve, he’ll keep on working hard. Let us support Lucio’s fighting spirit and not let him get discouraged by life’s difficulties through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Lucio, es un hombre que a pesar de tener sesenta años sigue irradiando gran optimismo, por más que las dificultades económicas por las que ha atravesado en algún momento lo hayan deprimido. Trabaja incesantemente por contribuir con todos los miembros de su numerosa familia y especialmente por el desarrollo de sus pequeños nietos que viven con él. El sostén diario requiere de una importante suma de dinero y es por ello que Lucio trabaja incansablemente en su chacrita cultivando diversos productos y cuidando a sus animalitos, que luego serán vendidos en la feria local, también decidió vender una amplitud de productos en un kiosquito para ayudar incrementar los ingresos económicos de su hogar.Él desea implementar adecuadamente este kiosco y mejorar su producción agrícola, con el propósito de elevar el nivel salud de su querida esposa, que con el paso de los años se ha deteriorado. Con el afán de ver cada vez mejor a su querida familia seguirá esforzándose. Apoyemos a Lucio a seguir lidiando y a no desalentarse por las dificultades de la vida, a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities and varietis of products for the small kiosk.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy is a man of great physical and spiritual strength. Day by day, he works arduously in order to yield great results with his crops. For this reason, he goes forth every morning with great determination and the tools necessary to complete his work. Thanks to his vigor, he has been able to support his family and provide them with both great fortune and an education. He efficiently supports his three children with his job, which has also permitted him to open a small grocery store in order to further provide for his daily family expenses. While Roy looks after his crops in the field, his wife is in charge of the grocery store that the family operates out of their home. Roy has inculcated his young children with this model of diligent labor so that they can conduct themselves adequately in life. He sees the good behavior of his older kids, who form an important part of their society. He is requesting a loan in order to increase production with the purchase of more supplies for his crops. Let’s work together with this prodigious father so that he may continue sowing hope with the anticipation of reaping happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Roy, es un hombre poseedor de mucha fortaleza física y espiritual, día a día trabaja arduamente para así obtener una muy buena producción y cosecha, es por eso que con mucho empeño sale cada mañana llevando a cuestas las herramientas que utilizará para un mejor desempeño de su labor. Gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado sostener y brindar a su familia educación y ventura. Con su trabajo mantiene eficientemente a sus tres hijos y esta actividad también le ha permitido abrir una bodega para apoyar con los gastos diarios del hogar. Mientras él permanece en el campo cuidando los cultivos para que en la cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos de su duro trabajo su esposa se encarga de brindar sus servicios en la pequeña bodega de casa.Este modelo de labor diligente ha sido inculcado en cada uno de sus seis hijos desde muy pequeños para que se conduzcan adecuadamente por la vida y puede observar con mucha alegría la buena conducta de sus hijos mayores dentro de su sociedad. Él solicita un préstamo para incrementar su producción con la compra de más insumos para su cultivo.Solidaricémonos con este prodigioso padre para que continúe sembrando esperanzas a fin de que pueda cosechar mucha felicidad.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta is a woman of great courage and dedication who struggles to put food on the table for her dependent children. She is a diligent mother who has always strived for the health and well-being of each member of her family. Throughout this season, she directs herself towards the fields where she plants coffee beans, yucca, and bananas. She sells the fruits of her labor at various local markets. She was a bit discouraged last year, when she had to sell her house in Villa Rica due to a heavy economic crisis she experienced. Despite this misfortune, she has not lost her strength to push forward because she is responsible for taking care of her family. She works while waiting for the harvest. She plans to commercialize her crops at a much greater scale, but for this she needs a loan that will allow her to invest in such a project. Let’s contribute to this great effort done by a mother who wants the best for her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Asunta, es una mujer de mucho coraje y dedicación que se esfuerza por lograr que sus siete hijos, aún bajo la protección de su hogar tengan siempre un pan en la mesa a la hora de comer, ella es una madre diligente y desde siempre se esforzó por otorgarles bienestar y salud a cada uno de los miembros de su familia. Día a día por esta época se dirige a sus campos de cultivo donde acostumbra a sembrar plátano, yuca y café. La práctica en estas duras labores se ve premiada con la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado de la zona. Estuvo un poco desanimada al vender el año pasado su casa en Villa Rica tras una fuerte crisis económica por la que atravesaban. A pesar de este hecho no pierde la fortaleza que la caracteriza ya que tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar a su familia. Trabaja mientras espera que llegue la cosecha y ha planeado iniciar también la comercialización de sus productos en mayor escala y para ello requiere un préstamo para utilizarlo como capital de inversión. Contribuyamos con el gran esfuerzo de una madre que quiere lo mejor para su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater amount and a variety of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Guzmán

texts.es:
Since childhood, Victor has always demonstrated a love and special interest in planting and cultivating fruits. As an adolescent he learned to work in this field and through much effort has become a diligent farmer and has cultivated his fertile land to receive nature’s best products. Through these activities he’s been able to support his home which is comprised of two young children with another on the way; because of the pregnancy he had to help his wife with her seamstress work. Now in the prime of his 34 years, he continues to work for his children and his family. He already knows how he will go about increasing production and sales of his products, thus working towards a better quality of life as the products will be in high demand in the area. This way they’ll be able settle the household expenses and save enough to offer his family comfort and well being. He hopes to count on your support to complete his plans through a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor, desde pequeño siempre mostró un gran cariño y especial interés por las labores de siembra y cultivo de frutas, ya de joven aprendió a pulir esta capacidad y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un diligente agricultor y a obtener los mejores productos que le ofrece la naturaleza a través de sus fértiles tierras de cultivo.Con esta actividad ha podido contribuir satisfactoriamente con su hogar que esta compuesto por dos hijos menores y uno que esta próximo a nacer por lo cual, Víctor, tuvo que dedicarse a apoyar a su esposa en su labor de costurera, sin embargo ahora en la plenitud de sus 34 años de edad, continúa esforzándose por sus hijos y su familia.Y ha contemplado el proyecto de incrementar la producción y venta de sus productos otorgándoles mayor calidad por la buena demanda que estos tienen en la actualidad, para que de esta manera puedan solventar los gastos de su hogar y ahorrar lo necesario para ofrecerle comodidad y bienestar a su familia. Cuenta con vuestro apoyo para llevar a cabo sus planes a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of seeds and fertilizers for his farming land.

loans.name: David Radney

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and has 4 children: a girl and three boys. Their ages are 6, 4, 2, and a newborn baby boy who is 16 days old. His wife, Julieta, is taking classes at the university to become a high school teacher. David has a high school education, but he wants his children to go to the university.

David has had his woodshop for three years, and therefore, was able to secure an individual loan from Esperanza. In his woodshop, he takes orders from the community for items such as doors, tables, chairs, and bed frames. He is going to use his next loan from Esperanza to buy more machinery, such as an additional saw and drills to be able to expand the kind of furniture he can produce. He has one employee, and he also lets two neighborhood boys (ages 9 and 13) help out around the shop so they can learn the trade.

loans.use: To purchase more machinery, such as an additional saw and drills to be able to expand the kind of furniture he can produce

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 43 years old and is a single mother of four children, three boys and a girl (ages 26, 23, 18, 16); she also helps raise her three grandchildren.

The name of her food stand is “Cafeteria Linaury.” It is located on the main road outsiD. of the town of Samana, and most of her customers are passersby or her neighbors. She sells fresh fruit juice, sandwiches, fruit, baked goods, and typical Dominican food like “habichuela” (pinto bean soup) and “tostones” (fried plantains). Her sister also works at the food stand with her.

Mina already had her small food stand when she took out her first loan from Esperanza, so she was able to secure an individual loan. With her first loan she re-stocked the shelves, as well as bought new blenders to make her fruit smoothies. With this next loan, she hopes to continue to invest in her food stand, and hopefully be able to turn it into a full-fledged restaurant.

loans.use: Mina hopes to continue to invest in her food stand, and hopefully be able to turn it into a full-fledged restaurant.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and has a 24-year-old daughter and four grandchildren. Her husband’s name is Benjamin and he works in the food stand with her.

The name of her business is Comedor Mariquitin. She has owned a food stand for three years and sells such goodies as empanadas, fried chicken, fried fish, rice and beans, salad, friend plantains, juice and coffee.

This is the first loan she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she plans to use it to restock her cooking supplies. Before Esperanza, she had tried to take out a loan from a local moneylender, but the interest rate was so high that she ended up actually losing money on the transaction. She looks forward to the more flexible structure of Esperanza’s repayment system.

loans.use: To invest in her food production business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 70 years old. She is married and has 10 surviving children and 22 grandchildren. Her husband, Alfredo, used to be an agricultural worker, but cannot work anymore because his vision is fading. Lita has a fifth grade education and is illiterate, but she was able to put her children through high school. She lives in a small concrete house next door to her restaurant with her husband and two of her grandchildren.

Lita has owned a small restaurant for over 40 years; it is located on the main road outside of Samana and most of her customers are her neighbors and people she has grown up with. She also sells plantains, which grow on plantain trees she has behind her house. Now that her husband can no longer work, her restaurant has become her family’s primary source of income. She is seeking to take out her first loan from Esperanza to restock her shelves and increase her profits.

loans.use: To invest in her small restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business that is a bazaar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in buying more products (El crédito lo invertirá en compra de más productos.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business and construct a cement floor in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in holiday season merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investing in merchandise for Christmas season (Invertir en mercaderia para la epoca navideña)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in wholesale products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell basic necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in inventory and improve the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise for the coming Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new products for the high season in December

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vary the selection of items for the home in anticipation of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify the products in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of the business and expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise and also to invest in new products she wants to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade is 25 years old and a mother of one child, aged 6. She began her business before joining MBK. Through her business, she sells gasoline to the community. Ade can earn up to $5 per day. Her husband, Iwan, is a private school teacher who earns $60 per month.

Ade requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) so she can buy more gasoline to sell. She hopes to earn more income to help cover the family's daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline

loans.name: Vivi

texts.en:
Vivi S. is 30 years old and a mother of one child, aged 11. For the last few years, her business has been to sell sandals on credit. She usually travels around the area to sell the sandals. She can earn up to $5 per day. Her husband, Encep, works in a shoe factory in Tangerang. He earns $15 in salary per week.

Vivi is a member of MBK. She requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) so she can buy more sandals to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sandals

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en:
Yayah is 43 years old and lives with her youngest child, aged 11. Her other children are married and live separately from her. Yayah has a small stall where she sells some snacks, household goods and other items. She can earn up to $6 per day. Her husband, S., is a driver who earns $12 per week.

Yayah needs more capital to grow her business. She requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) to buy more goods to fill her stall. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing for his sales and to construct a proper sewing studio in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the variety of fruits he sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in rolls of film and photography supplies

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
Muhiddin K., 24, is married and has 1 child. After completing the 6th grade, as the oldest son, he had to take over from his handicapped father responsibility for sustaining his family. He began selling fruits and vegetables at the market in Panshanbe. To maintain his family’s quality of life during the inflation, Muhiddin must expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Косимов Мухиддин возраст 24 года , женат , имеет одного ребенка.После окончания 6-ти лет обучения в средней школе начал предпринимательскую деятельность на рынке Паншанбе по продаже фруктов и овощей.В семье он старший сын ,поэтому все семейные проблемы лежали на его плечах. Отец физически не способен обеспечивать семью.В связи с инфляцией в Таджикистане ему необходимо расширить свой бизнес для поддержки уровня жизни семьи.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bimavdjuda

texts.ru:
Bimavdjuda D. is married. Her husband is away working as a seasonal laborer. Bimavdjuda has a child, who lives with her in-laws. Bimavdjuda’s husband sends money from time to time, but the money he sends is not enough to sustain the family. Bimavdjuda’s quality of life improved, since she turned to MicroInvest for help. Now she plans to increase the assortment of good and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалолова Бимавджуда замужем, муж находиться в отъезде на заработке. У них один ребенок живет с родителями мужа. Муж время от времени присылает деньги, но эти средства не хватают для них. После того когда , он обратилась в Микроивесте , ее положение улучшилось. Ей необходимо и улучшить ассортимент и расширить бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Baroat M., 48, is married and has 4 children. Baroat sells clothing for children for 5 years. During the Winter season, Baroat plans to expand the assortment of clothing she sells. She has been a MicroInvest client since 2002 and wishes to receive a loan of 1,600 Tajik somoni.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирмамадова Бароат - возраст 48 лет замужем имеет 4-х детей .Имеет среднее образование ,5ть лет опыта работы в этой деятельности .Бароат продает детскую одежду ,т.к сейчас сезон зимней одежды она хочет расширить свой ассортимент.Она кредитуется в Микроинвесте с2002-го года ,и хочет получить текущий займ в сумме 1600 сомони

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: San'athon

texts.ru:
San'athon M. works as an administrator and also sells on a market to fill in the gap in income to sustain her family. Before starting her business, San'athon thoroughly studied its specifics and planned out every step. San'athon planned to borrow money from her friends and relatives—a hard thing to do, because few of them had any money. Therefore, her first business loan San'athon took from MicroInvest. Today, she plans to use the money to increase sales volume and revenue.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Санъатхон работает в администратором и паралельно торгует на рынке, так как заработанные средства не хватали для ее семьи. Перед тем как начать бизнес досканально изучала, советовалась со знакомыми и просчитывала каждый свой шаг. Санъатхон рассчитывала взять деньги в долг у друзей и родственников, что тоже было непросто, так как их ни у кого не было. Первые деньги в она получила в МИКРОИНВЕСТЕ , можно сказать, с них и начал свое дело. Сегодня она планирует увеличеть свои доходы и доходы своей семьи.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Upon graduation from college, Gulchehra A. worked as a teacher at a daycare center. She is divorced and has 2 children. After divorce, to sustain her family, Gulchehra had to sell on a market. She has been selling for 15 years. This year, Gulchehra is making improvements to her place of business to better preserve the quality and appearance of her goods. Gulchehra dreams of owning a small store and of providing her kids with proper education.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизбоева Гулчехра Мамараимовна после окончания училища, работала в детском саде воспитательницей. Разведена. Имеет 2 детей. После развода Гулчехра вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение матери. Уже в течение 15 лет она торгует на базаре. В этом году она обустраивает свое рабочее место чтобы зимой ее товары не потеряли свой вид и качество. Мечтает о собственной лавке и дать надлежащее образование детям.

loans.use: Making improvements to the place of business

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Yuliya A. moved from Ukraine to Tajikistan after finishing high school because of government orders. After the break-up of the USSR she was left unemployed and was forced to start trading. Recently she lost her husband and is now alone. Because she has some inventory left over from last year, she needs a small loan to replenish her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахророва Юлия после окончания средней школы перебралась из Украины в Таджикистан по распределению. После развала СССР она осталась без работы и вынуждена была выйти на рынок. Недавно потеряла мужа и осталась одна. Из-за большого остатка прошлогоднего товара (зимней) она нуждается в минимальном кредите.

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en: Ramila was born in 1980. She is single and lives in the Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. 3 years ago she decided to start a farming business. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Shahodat G. has been in this business for 11 years. She has 3 children and is a widow. She uses business profits to support her family and to save for her daughter’s wedding. She plans to use her loan to purchase inventory to sell in time for the New Year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гайбуллоева Шаходат занимается данным бизнесом в течение 11 лет. Имеет троих детей. Вдова. Доходы получаемые от бизнеса направляются на содержание семьи и для накопления для свадьбы дочки. Получив займ она намеревается закупить товар для продажи к новому году.

loans.use: Increasing of assortment of goods

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat is a happy mother of 4 children and sells dishes, thermoses and kettles. She is 37 years old and has been in this business for 10 years. Her husband sells small goods at the market. Muhabbat’s children are good students in high school. She will use this loan to expand her business in order continue to support her family’s standard of living.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мухаббат счастливая мать 4-х детей ,которая занимается продажей посуды и термосов и чайников.Самой Мухаббат 37 лет, уже 10 лет как занимается торговлей, муж также торгует на базаре мелкой розницей.Дети прилежные ученики в средней школе.Займ хочет взять для расширения своего бизнеса,чтоб поддерживать уровень жизни семьи.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Manuel Bernardo

texts.pt:
Manuel Bernardo M. lives in Corumana in the district of Moamba in Maputo. He entered the program in November of 2007 with a loan of 6.000MT. He fishes by the Corumana Dam, and during the off season he sells beef. He is looking for a loan for $425US to help him buy and sell beef. He has already started construction on his home using conventional materials. In the past he only had a house built with precarious materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel Bernardo M. vive em Corumana, distrito da Moamba em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Pratica a pesca na barragem de Corumana e na época do defeso compra e vende carne de vaca. Vai tomar agora um emprestimo de 10.000MT para aplicar na compra e venda da carne de vaca. O cliente começou já uma obra de cosntrução de sua residência com material convencional. No ciclo passado tinha apenas uma casa feita de material precário.

loans.use: Buy and Sell Beef

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
Shavkat N. has been in business for over 4 years. He is married and has 4 children. The profits from his business go to family expenditures. Shavkat will use his loan to expand his product assortment of winter goods.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нарзуллоев Шавкат Хабибуллоевич более 4 лет занимается бизнесом. Женат, имеет 4 несовершеннолетних детей. Весь доход получаемый от бизнеса идет на покрытие семейных затрат. Шавкат хочет расширить свой ассортимент зимним товаром и увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru:
Mosharif U. has been in business for 6 years. She has a high school education. She is single and supports her daughter on her own. She brings her goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan.

Mosharif became a businesswoman when she was left single. She started with a small product selection and a small space – today she rents a sales location. She will use her loan to expand her product assortment and to open another sales location for her unemployed daughter.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарова Мошариф Алиевна уже 6 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Имеет среднее образование. В настоящее время она одинока и одна обеспечивает дочь. Товар привозит из оптового рынка г.Истаравшан. Занялась предпринимательством, после того как осталась одна с малого объема и ассортимента товара – в настоящее время арендует торговую точку. Стремиться увеличить объем товара, открыть дополнительную точку для безработной дочки.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda S. is 37, college educated, mother of 3. She has been an active client of Microinvest since 2002. In the beginning she was selling spools, elastic and other retail goods. Now she has a wider assortment of goods and her business is growing. She sells children clothing at the market in the city of Hugend. In the future Mavluda hopes to open a new trading place.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Сангиноива Мавлюда- возраст 37 лет ,мать 3их детей имеет высшее образование.С 2002 года кредитуется в МЗФ Микроинвесте.При первом кредите она торговало мелкой розницей ,нитки ,резинки и.т.д.А на сегоднешний день ее ассортимент увеличился и изменился,т.к. товарооборот увеличивается.Продает она на рынке Худжанда детскую одежду.И в дальнейшем хочет открыть новую точку продажи.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru:
Uguloy K. has been engaged in an enterpreneurial activity for more than 8 years. Her business is the main source of her family income. She supports six persons - her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Currently she is looking for a loan to buy wholesale and to increase the inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Холбекова Угулой занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 8 лет и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов в семье. В семье имеет 6 иждивенца (невестка , 2 внука, муж и 2 сына). На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет оптом приобрести товар у оптовиков по более низкой цене.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Zarrina sells fruits and greens. She has a son who is in 7th grade who helps with her business. Zarrina’s husband works as a guard at a local factory, but his salary is not enough to provide a good living. That is why Zarrina and her son sell from morning to evening in the market. Zarrina want to use her loan to increase the variety of produce she sells, which will increase her profits.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Заррина занимается продажей фруктов и зелени.Имеет сына ,который учится в 7 классе и помогает маме по бизнесу.Муж Заррины работает охранико на фабрике,но его зарплата не достаточна чтоб полнлценно жить .Поэтому Заррина и ее сын с утра до вечера торгуют на рынке.Взяв кредит она хочет увеличить ассортимент а значит и прибыль.

loans.use: Increase variety of produce

loans.name: Hayom

texts.ru:
Hayom is married and has three children. He has been working with MicroInvest since last year. Hayom started his business by selling beans and he was quite successful. After he saved enough money, Hayom decided to change his business and began selling vegetables instead. He wants to increase the variety of produce by adding different products.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хайём женат, имеет троих детей. Кредитуется в Микроинвесте с прошлого года. Хайём начал пробовать делать то, что у него лучше всего получается. А лучше всего он умел перепродавать бобовые. И решил продолжить свое дело, подкопив денег, предприниматель сначала опробовали на продажей бобовых продуктов со временем изменил свой асссортимент , на овощи. Сейчас кроме старого бизнеса имеется и другие товары.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru:
Mahsad G. is 46 years old, is married and has one daughter. She has been receiving loans from MicroInvest since 2002. At the start of her business, she was buying fabrics from local suppliers, since she did not have enough money for transport expenses. Because of that, her profits were lower. As her business grew, Mahsad’s turnover and profits began to increase and she was able to travel to buy fabrics herself. Mahsad wants to use her new loan to add winter fabrics to her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Махсад Гайбуллаева - возраст 46 лет замужем имеет одну дочь. С 2002 года является кредитором в Микроинвесте. В начале своего бизнеса она закупала товар, материи у поставщиков, т. к у нее не было финансов на транспортные расхода по бизнесу , что ей не позваляло иметь нормального дохода. Но со временем она стала ездить за товаром сама,т.к. ее оборот стал увеличиваться, и прибыль соответственно тоже. Взяв следующий кредит она хочет увеличить зимние ткани.

loans.use: To buy winter fabrics

loans.name: Kutfi

texts.ru:
Kufti G. has one daughter. Before Kutfi worked as a secondary school teacher, but because of the low pay she decided to start her own business. She has been selling children’s clothes for the past 4 years. This year she started working with MicroInvest and she wants to use her loan to expand her inventory and increase sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гадойбоева Кутфи мать единственной дочери. Раньше работала учительницей в средней школе ,но т.к. зарплата не достаточна она решила начать предпринимательскую деятельность.Занимается уже как 4 года продажей детской одежды . В этом году начала кредитоваться и хочет увеличить свой товарооборот.

loans.use: To increase sales turnover

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar is 37 years old. She is a mother of three kids and has a higher education. For the past 10 years, Dilbar has been an entrepreneur. When she first started her business, Dilbar sold clothes in different markets. Currently she is renting a space in a department store. Because of inflation, Dilbar decided to apply for a loan with MicroInvest. She wants to expand her inventory and open a new point of sale in the future.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Дильбар возраст 37 лет ,мать троих детей, имеет высшее образование. Уже 10 лет как она занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Раньше она торговала на базарах,а сейчас арендует отдел в магазине. Но в связи с инфляцией она хочет расширить ассортимент. И решила кредитоваться в Микроинвесте. В даоьнейшем хочет открыть еще один отдел.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba D. is a mother of four children. She started to work with Microinvest in 2002, and she is an active and responsible clients. She is very good at selling because she serves her clients quickly and politely, and they like her good assortment of shoes. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to further expand her business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: 38-year-old Mrs. Rita U. is a mother of 4 children, is married and lives in Benin City with her family. She has a store where she sells soup items. She learned this business for a year and then started her own in 2004. She is soliciting for a loan to buy more soup items to sell; she is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more soup-making items for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth O. is married with 5 children and lives in Benin City; she is 51 years old. She sells palm oil, and she acquired her knowledge from her mother. She started her own business in 1987, and she is soliciting a loan to enable her buy more palm oil to sell. She has been a LAPO member (the lender) for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Mr. Stephen Egyir is an auto electrician at moree junction near cape coast. He was once married with two children ages 11 and 8 years but he is currently divorced. Stephen has it own electrician shop where he works on all kinds of car batteries. Stephen is a hardworking man. He also repairs all types of car starters, altenators and sells cutout too as well. He is w well known electrician at moree junction.
Stephen is asking for a loan of US $ 1,000 dollars to enable him purchase car starters, second-hand batteries, car altenators and cutout to enable him meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To  buy car starters, second-hand batteries, car altenators, cutouts, clips etc.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Mrs. Benedicta A. is 42 yrs old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City. She sells yams and dried fish; she learned this business for 2 months and then started her own in 1996. According to her, when given a loan she will be able to buy more dried fish to be sold. She is a LAPO member (the lender).

loans.use: To buy more dried fish, crayfish & yams to sell

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en: Mazakhir was born in 1986, and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. He has a general store, where he sells clothes, slippers, etc. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve his business and to attract more clients. This will allow him to increase his income. He started his business eight years ago.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Isaac Blankson is a carpenter who manufactures all kinds of furniture. He is married with five children. The wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, soaps etc. He works very hard to support the wife since the wife’s income is low. He also makes coffins and supplies organizations with all kinds of furniture.
He is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group”. The members of this group have known each other for many years and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – Accra Highway.
One challenge that Issac faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from some financial organizations.
As a result, Philip needs a loan of US $ 1,100 dollars to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools and the material used in the manufacturing of the furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Aliboi

texts.ru:
Aliboi has been receiving loans since 2006, he sells rice. He, like many starting businessmen, has been at times running into the grim reality and began to realize that alone he will not be able to take his business to the next level. Maybe the lack of loan opportunities, maybe lack of experience in assessing his the buisness' direction, maybe the fact that he was doing it alone, but in the end our businessman decided to seriously think about the possibility of doing serious business. He decided to turn to Microinvest and to increase his total capital by taking out a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Алибой кредитуется с 2006 года, он торгует рисом. Он как и многие начинающие бизнесмены, начинал свой бизнес, порой сталкивался с суровой реальностью и начинал осознавать, что в одиночку он не в состоянии продвинуть свое дело на следующую ступень. То ли сказывался недостаток финансовых возможностей, то ли опыта в определенном направлении ведения бизнеса, то ли просто в одиночку не осиливал и тогда наш бизнесмен начал серьезно задумываться о возможном серьезном бизнесе. Он обратился в Микроинвест и увеличел свой капитал.

loans.use: selling food stuffs/groceries

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Georgina Aikins is a seamstress who sows all kinds of dresses. She is well known for the sowing of “kaba” a popular Ghanaian dress. She also sows children and baby dresses too as well. Georgina is married and she has two children ages 3 and 1 respectively. Her husband is a driver who has his own car. Georgina works very hard. To support the finances of her family, she also sells cloth, materials used for sowing dresses, thread, tape measures etc. She also sells mineral water.
She is also a member of the lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group” and they provide support for each other. They have also known each others in the group for a long time.
Georgina, is asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to enable her buy an additional hand sewing machine, fill her store with cloths, materials, thread, needles and tape measures.

loans.use: Georgina, is asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to enable her buy an additional hand sewing machine, fill her store with cloths, materials, thread, needles and tape measures.

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.en:
Alfiya is a mother of two children. She has worked with Microinvest since 2003. She is an intelligent woman who quickly understands her clients' needs and tries to satisfy them. Her clients are happy with her business, because they always find the necessary items they need at her shop. Today she has created a good turnover of working capital. She is requesting a loan of $975 to develop her business further.
Before New Year, she plans to buy more winter clothes and try to get more income from clothes sale.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Yakubu Abdulai is a trader at moree junction near cape coast. She sells provisions such as milk, milo, frytol cooking oil, oaths, pepsodent, tape batteries, bulbs, detol, cheese etc. He is married with two children ages 9 and 5 years respectively. The wife is also a trader who manages another store owned by her husband.
Yakubu is a hardworking man. He also sells groundnut, maize, beans, yam etc. He brings them from the northern part of the country and supplies them to some junior and senior high schools within and outside cape coast. He is a well known trader. He also sells cosmetics, mineral water, minerals such as coco cola, malt, fanta etc.
One major challenge that yakubu faces is the high cost (transportation cost) of bringing the foodstuffs from the northern part of the country to supply his customers, schools etc.
He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 dollars to enable him pay for the high cost of transportation, bring in more food such as maize, yam, groundnut, sweet potatoes to supply to the junior and senior high schools. He also wants to buy more creams and body lotions to fill his cosmetic store.

loans.use: Buy foodstuffs (maize, yam, groundnut, sweet potatoes) to supply to his customers (junior and senior high schools)

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Alice Adu – Gyamfi is a trader at moree junction. She sells fante kenkey, a popular Ghanaian food, sweet potatoes and body creams. She is deceased and has seven children. She is a hardworking woman. In order to take very good of her family, she also travel to the northern part of the country to buy maize, groundnut, yam and supply them to his customers in and around cape coast. She is well known for the supply of maize and groundnut. Occasionally, she also sells body creams and lotions. 
One major challenge Alice faces is that she has received a lots of orders from her customers for the supply of maize, yam and groundnut because the prices of these foodstuffs are relatively low in the northern part of Ghana than the south.
Alice is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to enable her travel to the north to buy the foodstuffs (maize, yam, groundnut, sweet potatoes) and supply to her customers.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to buy foodstuffs (maize, yam, sweet potatoes, groundnut) for distribution to her customers

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.ru:
Muqadas is a seamstress with 25 years experience. She works in the local alterations store and she has 3 children. Primarily she sews clothes on commission. Until last year she only made national costumes, but now she would like to start sewing european-style women's clothes in large numbers under commission.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мукадас портниха со стажем 25 лет. Она работает в городском ателье, у нее трое детей. Она в основном шьет на заказ одежду. До прошлого года она шила ,только национальные платья,а теперь имея свой капитал, она шьет на заказ в большом ассортименте европейскую женскую одежду.

loans.use: Sewing of clothes (шитье одежды)

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: Dildora M. is married and she lives with her family in Spitamen. She has worked in a bazaar since 2003, and in these five years in clothing sales, she has showed she is very capable of making this a good business. Her quick mind and well-developed business skills has helped her be a success. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand her business, which will raise her family's income.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en: Gulbaniz is 39 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and two children. She has run her own farm for the past 19 years. Gulbaniz has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo is highly skilled lady who works in a bazaar and in her home, sews dresses tailored to her country's national heritage. Her dresses are popular, because she sews very beautifully. Sometimes she sells the dresses she hand makes in the bazaar, but mostly those are sewn from orders. In the bazaar, she sells women's clothing to demanding clients. She is requesting a loan of $1,025 so she can improve the assortment of the clothes she sells, and increase her business.

loans.use: To improve stock and expand business

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz has been in this business for 18 years. He is 23 years old, and lives in Khaladj village. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs in order to make more income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat A. has been selling goods at the market for the last 12 years. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband used to be the sole bread winner. He works as a driver and earns 150 somoni (43$) a month. This was not enough to feed the family of seven. The children were growing and more money was needed. With every day the financial needs of the family grew and so Saodat was forced to find work. She chose to work at the market and to help her family's financial situation by selling fabrics. She received her first loan in the beginning of 2006 from Microinvest. During the following 2 years she has been taking out loans from the foundation and is a dependable client. She is looking for an additional loan to finance the increase in fabric assortment at her market stand.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдукодирова Саодат в течение 12 лет торгует на рынке. Замужем. Имеет 5 детей. Муж был, единственным кто зарабатывал в семье. Он работает водителем и получает 150 сомони (43$) в месяц. Этого недостаточно, чтоб прокормит семью из 7 человек. Дети становились, взрослыми и их надо было обустроить. С каждым днем расходы семьи увеличивались. Саодат была вынуждена искать работу. Так она начала работать на базаре и зарабатывая на пропитание семьи, торгуя тканью. Она получила первый кредит в начале 2006 года от Микроинвест. В течение последних 2 лет кредитуется в фонде и является образцовой клиенткой. Она нуждается в финансировании для увеличения ассортимента товара.

loans.use: Goods' assortment increasing

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en: Gulu (his father is pictured) was born in 1984, and lives in Yenikand village. He has his own farming business. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru:
Mipsharif Saloevich A. has been selling clothes on the market for 17 years. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is not employed and the clothes business is the primary source of income for the Asrarov family. At first he was purchasing clothes in credit from the wholesalers and selling them at the market. However, due to the competition on the market Mr. A. was forced to find an alternative lending source... In the beginning of 2005 he found out about the credit program "Microintrest". Mr. A. received a loan and with that money was able to purchase goods from wholesalers without credit, which resulted in lower prices. After receiving more loans he was able to import the goods himself, bypassing the wholesaler altogether. Currently Misharif A. regularly travels to Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) himself to import the clothes he will sell at the market. He also sells clothes in credit to the small merchants from kishlaks (mountain villages) which is profitable for both parties. A part of the income he uses to support his family, but majority he has dedicated to expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Асроров Миршариф Салоевич в течение 17 лет торгует на вещевом рынке. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена не работает, не имеет постоянного дохода. Торговля на рынке основной доход семьи. Впервые время он брал за безналичный расчет под реализацию товар у оптовиков и продавал. Из-за конкуренции на рынке он был вынужден искать источник финансирования... В начале 2005г он узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив, первый кредит он начал за наличные деньги покупать товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам. После получения следующих кредитов у него появилась, возможность самому привозит товар. В данное время он привозит товар сам из Бишкека (Кыргызстан) Теперь она сама дает под реализацию мелким торговцам из кишлаков, что взаимовыгодно обеим сторонам. Часть прибыли она тратит на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть направляет в свой бизнес.

loans.use: Goods' assortment increasing

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru:
Mipsharif Saloevich A. has been selling clothes on the market for 17 years. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is not employed and the clothes business is the primary source of income for the Asrarov family. At first he was purchasing clothes in credit from the wholesalers and selling them at the market. However, due to the competition on the market Mr. A. was forced to find an alternative lending source... In the beginning of 2005 he found out about the credit program "Microintrest". Mr. A. received a loan and with that money was able to purchase goods from wholesalers without credit, which resulted in lower prices. After receiving more loans he was able to import the goods himself, bypassing the wholesaler altogether. Currently Misharif A. regularly travels to Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) himself to import the clothes he will sell at the market. He also sells clothes in credit to the small merchants from kishlaks (mountain villages) which is profitable for both parties. A part of the income he uses to support his family, but majority he has dedicated to expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer.

Асроров Миршариф Салоевич в течение 17 лет торгует на вещевом рынке. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена не работает, не имеет постоянного дохода. Торговля на рынке основной доход семьи. Впервые время он брал за безналичный расчет под реализацию товар у оптовиков и продавал. Из-за конкуренции на рынке он был вынужден искать источник финансирования... В начале 2005г он узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив, первый кредит он начал за наличные деньги покупать товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам. После получения следующих кредитов у него появилась, возможность самому привозит товар. В данное время он привозит товар сам из Бишкека (Кыргызстан) Теперь он сам дает под реализацию мелким торговцам из кишлаков, что взаимовыгодно обеим сторонам. Часть прибыли он тратит на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть направляет в свой бизнес.

loans.use: Goods' assortment increasing

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Bakhtiyor A. is married and has 3 children. He has been in the business of reselling various types of dishes for 10 years. His wife Mahbuba Akhunova is helping him because this business is the sole source of income for their family.

After separation of Tajikistan from the Soviet Union, he has lost his job. For this reason he started reselling dishes on the market. He transports his goods from the city of Hujanda. Currently, he doesn't have sufficient amount of funds to increase the assortment of his inventory. The earnings obtained during the previous months were partially used to fix his house before the beginning of the winter season.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Ахунов Бахтиёр Камолович женат. Имеет 3-их детей. Он занимается, куплей продажей столовой посуды занимается около 10 лет. Из за того что этот бизнесч является основным источником дохода семьи в этом деле ему помогает жена Ахунова Махбуба. После распада СССР он остался без работы и чтоб прокормить семью начал торговать на рынке перепродажей столовой посуды товара. Он привозит товар из города Худжанда. На данный момент он имеет не большой оборотный капитал и для расширения ассортимента товара он нуждается в финансировании. На полученный доход от прошлых месяцев он частично отремонтировал дом до наступления холодов.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Gulgaz

texts.en: Gulgaz is a mother of three children. She and her family live in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. This 40-year-old woman started a farming business 9 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher M. has been in the bakery business for 7 years. So that he could provide for his family, he started working as a trainee in one of the local bakeries at the age of 16. For one work shift that usually lasted 17 hours he was only paid 6 to 7 loafs of bread, which was not enough for his family. He started looking for a space so he could open his own business. Once he found one, he started his own bakery. In the beginning, he was only baking for special orders for weddings because he was short of cash. After a period of time, when he accumulated more funds, he started producing bread for the sales on the market. Currently, his father and two hired employees, who are paid 450 somoni, are helping him in the business. Alisher is asking for additional funding so that he could increase his production.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Мусоев Алишер занимается производством хлеба 7 лет. Чтобы прокормит семью он начал работать с 16 лет учеником в одном из предприятий по производству хлеба. За одну рабочую смену продолжительность которого составляет, 17 часов ему выплачивали в качестве заработной платы по 6 –7 хлеба (лепешек). Этого не хватало, чтоб прокормить семью. Он начал искать помещение для открытия собственного дела. Он нашел помещение и начал свою деятельность. В первое время он пек хлеб по заказу на свадьбы из-за нехватки средств. После некоторого времени он начал производит хлеб из собственных средств (заработанных) для продажи на рынке . В данное время ему в этом помогают отец и двое наемных рабочих которым он платит заработную плату в размере 450 сомони. Для расширения производства он нуждается в финансировании.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Magrur

texts.en: Magrur is a single man. He lives in Khaladj village. A 24-year-old man, he has 10 years of experience with his business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foodstuffs to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Olatunji

texts.en: Olatunji M. is a mother of 2, 35 years old, and hails from Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes in her community. She is a LAPO member (the lender) and has been in business for years. She is in needs a loan to buy more clothes to be sold.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Hannah Amissah Brown sells provisions such as milk, milo, pepsodent, sugar, rice, biscuits etc. she is married with one daughter aged 14 years. Her husband is a photographer and his income is low. To help with the family finances, Hannah works very hard. She also buys eggs and distributes them to her customers. Her shop is also located at a busy market here in cape coast.
One major challenge that Hannah faces is that she has to make an advance payment before she receives her supply (eggs) from her suppliers. At the moment, she has lots of orders from her customers for the supply of eggs.
Hannah is asking for a loan of US $ 1,100 dollars to enable her buy more eggs and supply it to her customers.

loans.use: To buy eggs to supply to her customers

loans.name: Gulgaz

texts.en: Gulgaz (her sister is pictured) was born in 1968, and lives in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. She is a mother of 3 children. 8 years ago she started a farming business to support her family. Now Gulgaz needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Hagah Boateng sells yam. She is married and has four children. The husband is also a trader. Hagah is a hardworking woman. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to bring yam and sell. She also supplies schools with large quantity of yam. She is well known at tantri, where she sells her yam.
One major challenge that Hagah faces is that she is not able to bring in yam in large quantities because of lack of capital. She always receives orders from her customers for the supply of yam.
She is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,000 dollars so that she can bring the yam in large quantities from the northern region and supply to her customers.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan of US $ 1,000 to enable her buy the yam in large quantities and supply to her customers.

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en: Turbat has sold clothes for 15 years. He is 33 years old, lives in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village.  This single man needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Safiratu

texts.en: Mrs. Safuratu M. is 40 years old, married with 4 children, and she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells charcoal to people. She has been in business for years, and she need a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan was born in 1962. He has 2 children and is divorced.  He lives in the Salyan region, in the Khaladj village.  He has been in this business for 12 years. He has cattle. Now he needs a loan of  $1200 to buy bailing presses.

loans.use: to buy bailing presses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
ANGELA, age 34, lives with her 5-year-old daughter and her brother’s 2 children (ages 19 and 8). While her brother gives her some financial assistance for raising his children, she supports her home through the profits she earns from her shop. Her shop, called “Angel’s Boutique,” is open from 8:30am to 6:30pm daily and sells imported clothing, shoes, and accessories for women and children. She opened her shop 4 years ago right after she finished doing secretarial studies.

Her business consists of traveling to Dubai around 3 times a year to bring back clothes to sell in Dar es Salaam. From one dress she buys in Dubai, she is able to earn about $10 in profit. At her shop, around 3 or 4 customers come in every day, and she is able to make a profit of around $225 each week. She uses some of her profits to pay the shop rent of $90 a month and to also pay her shop assistant’s salary.

Earlier this year, Angela took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to hire someone to travel to Kampala, Uganda, to purchase jewelry for her shop. She was able to pay this loan back successfully. With this new loan, she hopes to return to Dubai sometime before Christmas to purchase more clothing.

She belongs to the group Tiger, which consists of 22 other members who keep each other accountable and support one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Dubai

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Mrs. Sadia D. is 26 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in Lagos state. Nigeria. She sells pharmaceuticals to her neigbhouring community where there is no chemist store (pharmacy); she has been a LAPO member for 2 years. She needs the loan to enable her buy more pharmaceuticals to sell.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals to sell.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. sells cosmetics, lace materials, thread, needles, handkerchiefs, baby diapers, and provisions such as milk, soap, and minerals. Salamatu is married and has three children ages 15, 6 and 3 years old. Her husband is an electrician but his income is low. Salamatu works very hard. To help with the family finances, she also sells shoes and mineral water. Her store is located at Moree Junction, about 5km from Cape Coast.

She is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group” located on the Yamoransa – Accra highway.

Salamatu is asking for a loan of US $800 to fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, minerals, lace materials, thread, and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, and bags of rice. She intends to pay the loan back within seven months.

loans.use: To fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, and pepsodent.

loans.name: Tolani

texts.en: Tolani T. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells bread and has been in this business since the year 2004. She is in need of a loan of $375 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Olawumi

texts.en: Olawumi P. is happily married with 3 children. She is 30 years old and she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells all kinds of fruit to people living in her community. She has been in the business for the past 7 years. She is in need of a loan to enable her buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in higher quality wood and workshop tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bicycles to sell during the holiday season and to continue supplying his workshop with necessary supplies

loans.name: Subgroup G Of Salasala

texts.en:
HADIJA, in her early thirties, is a single mother of her 6-year-old boy. She has a shop where she sells different food items and cosmetics. She opened this shop about 3 years ago, and it is now open daily from 6am to 9pm. The shop serves about 20 customers a day and makes a profit of about $64 per week. Hadija’s sister is her shop assistant. With this business, she can now support herself.

Hadija is the leader of Subgroup G in group Salasala (named after their location in Dar es Salaam), which totals 44 members. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members: Zaina M. (grilled meat vendor), Maria F. (quarry worker), Luciana S. (food vendor), and Roze S. (shopkeeper). Hadija knows her group quite well because they are all neighbors. Three of them have taken a previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and paid it back successfully. This is Hadija and Rose’s first loan from Tujijenge. Their group promises to monitor each other closely for successful repayment. With the new loan, Hadija wishes to purchase more food and cosmetics for her shop.

In the picture, Hadija is on the far right.

loans.use: To purchase food and cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Somtochukwu

texts.en: Somtochukwu Okunkwo is 35 old, married with 5, and lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells electrical goods such as outlets, cords and parts. She has been in this business since the year 2001 and needs a loan to buy more electrical materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy more electrical goods and parts to sell

loans.name: Emem

texts.en: Emem O. is 29 years old, married and has a child; she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks and cooked food at her restaurant. She has been in her business since the year 2003 and needs a loan to buy drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en: Mrs. Nerisa E. is 29 years old, married and has a child; she lives in Lagos states, Nigeria. She has been a LAPO member (with the lender) for 2 years. She is a fashion designer and also sells clothes. She needs a loan to buy more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. This she said will make her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & tailoring material for sale

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: "Through the financial assistance I receive from LAPO, my business has increased in volume and in values," says Miss Chioma A., who is 27 years old and lives in Lagos state Nigeria. She has been in her business since 2002 and needs a loan to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera E. is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells cooked food, and she has been in this business for the past 3 years. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and a refrigerator. This she said will help her serve others. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foods to cook and sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: A. Bola is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children and she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a stylist and also sells hair cream and relaxer. She has 14 years experience in this business. She needs a loan to buy more hair cream, relaxer, and weaving product to sell.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream and relaxer to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been an LAPO member for 2 years and needs a loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Mrs. Kemi O. is 41 years old, married and has 4 children; she lives in Afromedia in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs to people in her communities. She has been in this business since 2002 and needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en: Afolabi I. is a widow with 2 children. She is 50 years old. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is also a fashion designer. She has been in her business since 1996, and she is in need of a loan to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and materials for sewing.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to stock the store shelves.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 22 years old and a mother of one child, aged 1. She sells clothes on credit. She travels around her village and surrounding areas to sell the clothes. Dina can earn up to $5 per day. Her husband, S., sells clothes at the market.

Dina is a member of MBK. She requests IDR 500,000 ($75 USD) to buy more towels, clothes and other items for her business' inventory. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 52 years old, married with 5 children; she comes from Afromedia in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, eggs, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in her business some years and needs a loan to enable her buy more items to stock her store shelves.

loans.use: To buy more store provisions such as eggs, drinks & food

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel A. is a fridge repairer and also sells used fridges for the home (second-hand fridges) imported into the country from Europe. He is 35 years of age and married with three children ages 12 years, 5 years, and 6 months. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk and soaps. Gabriel is a hardworking man. To help with the family finances, he also sells fridge motors. His shop is located at Moree Junction, on the Yamoransa – Accra highway. Gabriel has suppliers who always supply him with fridges and the fridge motors, and he is a well-known fridge repairer. He also repairs air conditioners.
